46833: The Film is put on the motives of a well-known story of M. Karamzin about the tragic love of the poor girl to the rich young man.

102809: The journey of a contemporary, porn-addicted Don Juan-type as he attempts to become less selfish.

Dragon Ball Z 2: The World's Strongest

48721: Lawrence Bourne III (Tom Hanks, at his obnoxious best) is having a bad day: He’s on the lam for a gambling debt, and ends up in the Peace Corps in Thailand.

36914: A documentary about Tiffany fanatics. Literally.

28070: Teenage boys discover discipline and camaraderie on an ill-fated sailing voyage.

30883: A society rat finds his match deep in the bowels of London Town.

4312: In Victorian London, the handsome Dorian Gray (Ben Barnes) is swept into a social whirlwind by the charismatic and cunning Lord Wotton (Colin Firth).

15414: An emotionally distant writer of travel guides must carry on with his life after his son is killed and his marriage crumbles.

37656: The son of a Jewish cantor must defy his father in order to pursue his dream of being a pop singer.

97075: A famous artist strives to find the secret of eternal life through the beautiful mannequins he creates.

I'm Glad That My Mother Is Alive

87480: A short black-and-white silent trick film featuring a wizard, a Pierrot and a sculptor in a rapid series of jump-cuts, which is another exercise in the art of the jump-cut.

Cybele: A Pastoral Ritual in Five Scenes

3094: Hysterical Californians prepare for a Japanese invasion in the days after Pearl Harbor.

117724: Jacq Vaucan, an insurance agent of ROC robotics corporation, routinely investigates the case of manipulating a robot. What he discovers will have profound consequences for the future of humanity.

96738: Divinations is a hallucinatory, dizzying, and meditative collage of image and sound.  The work is part of de Hirsch’s (1912-2000) trilogy of films entitled The Color of Ritual, the Color of Thought (1964–67).

The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Miss Osbourne

20432: La danse - Le ballet de l'Opéra de Paris

119836: Told from the female perspective, the story of a couple trying to reclaim the life and love they once knew and pick up the pieces of a past that may be too far gone.
The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Her

21668: The action takes place in the Crimea, the southern part of the former Soviet Union. The characters are all people hostile to society; they’ve got their own reasons for being so, their own lack of understanding.

22463: Built around amateur videos, demonstration footage and excerpts from a demonstrator-controlled Bucharest TV studio in late December 1989.

119952: How much does Fúsi weigh? Twenty-four stone? More? No one can say, not even Fúsi himself. Because ultimately the 43-year-old is sleepwalking through life.

11246: A man spreads the rumor of his fake homosexuality with the aid of his neighbor, to prevent his imminent firing at his work.

94646: Lessons in life about love: eight of these lessons about Peter from the age of ten to forty. Growing up as a homosexual in Indonesia. Autobiographical? The filmmaker is only 31. A filmmaker who had the logo of this festival tattooed on his hand. He’s our fan and we are his fan.

33160: Two wannabe heroes and their friends must stop a madman from giving everyone nightmares.

95860: Jimmy and Cherie have split up — but can’t seem to forget each other.

12285: An inept British WWII commander leads his troops to a series of misadventures in North Africa and Europe.

150328: An ex-con reunites with his estranged wayward 16-year old daughter to protect her from drug dealers who are trying to kill her.

As the characters’ paths crisscross throughout the film’s puzzle-box structure, a portrait of post-May ’68 Paris and its dashed dreams emerges.

3583: Through a series of zany skits and songs, the British comedy troupe Monty Python tackles the seven stages of life, from the miracle of birth up to death.

43123: After she’s diagnosed with a terminal illness, a shy woman decides to take a European vacation.

20479: Everyday objects become delicious ingredients as we learn how to cook spaghetti through stop-motion photography.

23672: Woody Allen stars in Picking Up the Pieces, playing a butcher named Tex who cuts up his adulterous wife (played by Sharon Stone) in a jealous rage.

Life Is a Bed of Roses

43047: The film begins with a series of horizontally running ocean tide waves, sometimes with mountains in the background…

47181: A young doctor falls in love with a disturbed young woman, becomes involved in the death of her husband, and has to flee with her to the Mexican border.

25681: The tragic story of world renowned classic cellist Jacqueline du Pré, as told from the point of view of her sister, flautist Hilary du Pré-Finzi.

64199: Shortly after David Abbott moves into his new San Francisco digs, he has an unwelcome visitor on his hands: winsome Elizabeth Martinson, who asserts that the apartment is hers — and promptly vanishes.

8415: When a secret agent learns of his wife’s extra-marital affair, he pursues her and uses his intelligence resources in a job he kept secret from her.

39064: Depicts an investigation into the murder of an American civil rights activist in Northern Ireland by the police while driving in the company of a Provisional Irish Republican Army sympathiser.

27900: A Republican newspaper magnate intends to make her lover, an aircraft  tycoon, as a President of the United States with her as the power behind the stone.

8869: Chelios faces a Chinese mobster who has stolen his nearly indestructible heart and replaced it with a battery-powered ticker that requires regular jolts of electricity to keep working.

39100: Hillbilly, Will Stockdale, drafted into the United States’ Air Force, combines crushing naivety, stubbornness, a completely literal mind, and amazing physical strength. Will the Air Force survive all the numerous experiences?

27864: A nephew of a prominent judge and his latest conquest are held captive by a pair of criminals (one of them has a personal ax to grind with the nephew’s uncle the Judge).

22784: A man, recently separated from his wife, returns to rural Czechoslovakia after many years living in France. Nostalgic for the country of his youth, he forms a bond with an unmarried young pregnant woman who has been kicked out by her mother.

25449: An alcoholic Bosnian poet sends his wife and daughter away from Sarajevo so they can avoid the troubles there. However, he is soon descended upon by a pair of orphaned brothers.

40084: Mulder and Scully are called back to duty by the FBI when a former priest claims to be receiving psychic visions pertaining to a kidnapped agent.
The X-Files: I Want to Believe

99997: The author, the camera, the hero. The distance between them shrinks with every passing minute, and the author has to enter the shot and become a character in the story.

24613: Shipwrecked on an mysterious isle in the Sargasso Sea, Lansen and party find themselves prisoners of a bizarre inbred colony still governed by the long-abandoned edicts of the Spanish Inquisition.

44142: Music video directed by Miranda July.

19313: A guy’s life is turned around by an email, which includes the names of everyone he’s had sex with and ever will have sex with. His situation gets worse when he encounters a femme fatale (Ryder) who targets men guilty of sex crime.

27418: A comet wipes out most of life on Earth, leaving two Valley Girls to fight the evil types who survive.

18149: A young man who escaped the clutches of a murderous hitch-hiker is subsequently stalked, framed for the hitcher’s crimes, and has his life made into hell by the same man he escaped.

25835: The filmed depiction of a program where convicts tell troubled kids about the horrors of prison life.

24432: After newlyweds Olga and Michel set foot on the grounds of a women’s prison, they’re arrested by topless guards and ushered behind bars.

103152: Filed away and forgotten until now, Super-8 movies made by Nixon’s inner circle tell the story they thought they were a part of—before Watergate changed everything.

25668: This early short from Carlos Reygadas is a tiny, experimental, mixed-media dream about a young man’s existential portent amid memories of his mother.

39321: A young man (Edward Furlong) goes to prison and a tough, older convict (Willem Dafoe) takes him under his wing as a mentor.

20490: The story tells of a small town that is very much bothered by a very strange and weird man living in a visually haunted house…

39245: A plane crashes in the jungle. One of the survivors gets lost and while trying to find a way out of the jungle he gets captured by cannibals.

64014: Dispatched to an abandoned house after numerous reported ghost sightings, Lt. Daniel Bradford (Duke Moore) arrives on the scene, only to be greeted by a mute brute and a flimflamming spiritualist — who’s about to get his just desserts.

24556: A man goes to see his former schoolmate working at a boiler house and persuades him to burn in the furnace the corpse of his communal flat neighbor whom he has just murdered after a quarrel.

119744: A story based on the life of a struggling Long Island single mom who became one of the country’s most successful entrepreneurs.

21566: Somewhere in the Spanish country, in the 60s. Paco and his wife Régula are very poor. They work as tenant farmers for a very wealthy landowner. They have 3 children. One is backward. The others can not got to school because the master “needs” their work.

23453: The films draw inspiration from architectural sites redolent with ghosts of the past: the abandoned, overgrown, crumbling halls of Ellis Island and a medieval French village.

40109: Reclusive Rubin Farr teams up with vocal but unsuccessful multi-level salesman Ed Tuttle on a quest to bury Rubin’s dead cat in the “perfect spot”. Their trip takes them across Utah’s desert where they have run-ins with Ed’s ex-wife Rula and an elusive Andy Warhol critic.

22609: Based, in part, on the Tibetan Mandala of the Five Dhyani Buddhas / a journey toward the center of pure consciousness (Dharma-Dhatu Wisdom) / space and motion generated rather than illustrated / time-color energy create virtual shape / in negative time, growth is inverse decay.

27595: A mysterious drifter enters the lives of four high school girls, who otherwise don’t know one another, and help them fight back against the constant sexual harassment from their teachers and classmates.

42158: A frog man and a mysterious frog woman become curious when a house has the letters “HEX” on it’s roof.

21402: An innocent little girl loses her parents and winds up in the hands of scoundrels, only to acquire a purehearted protector in their ranks.

2984: It’s 1947 and the borderlines between India and Pakistan are being drawn. A young girl bears witnesses to tragedy as her ayah is caught between the love of two men and the rising tide of political and religious violence.

36215: Two escaped convicts (Laurel & Hardy) change clothes in the getaway car, but wind up wearing each other’s pants. The rest of the film involves their trying to exchange pants, in alleys, in cabs and finally high above the street on the girders of a construction site.

92738: A beautiful short film of 10 minutes orchestrating photos and recordings of Callas.

30382: This is the story of rival “Firms” of football supporters, and how one man has a wish to team them up for the European Championships of 1988. However, when this is discussed, the opposing leaders are not happy, as they believe this is a challenge to their authority.

29557: Six directors, six regards on the state of the world. Their cross over creates a new space for a dynamic and radical inquisitive reflection, a space to defy the future.

195: Jesse and Celine encounter one another nine years after their fateful meeting aboard a European train. Now, they have one afternoon to find out whether their bond has defied time and place and whether they belong together.

10191: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarrying the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.

95889: Starting with a quote from H.P. Lovecraft, Dawn of an Evil Millennium is crazy ride through a theorized trailer (short film) to an 18-hour cosmic horror film epic.

34244: Wah and Kinki both working at the same department of a computer company. Both of them are not getting on very well initially, but friendship develops when they get to know each other after a while.

77971: Returning home to grieve after the shocking death of his overachieving twin brother, an aimless slacker named Jerry finds himself inexplicably linked to a notorious terrorist cell and hotly pursued by federal authorities.

33189: Writer/director/producer Buddy Giovinazzo made his indelible debut with this nihilistic saga of a Vietnam vet’s desperate pursuit to save his family from the horrors of poverty and urban squalor.

1697: Against the backdrop of the first Gulf War, Jasira Maroun is 13, physically well developed but naïve and unable to say no. As puberty arrives, her mother sends her from Syracuse to Houston to her curt, up-tight, Lebanese-born father.

49362: Michelle Pfeiffer is ferocious in the role of a desperate mother whose 3-year-old son disappears during her high school reunion. Nine years later, by chance, he turns up in the town in which the family has just relocated.
The Deep End of the Ocean

93406: Black-and-white video portraying Madonna coming to a hotel room to satisfy her sexual fantasy. Scenes of sadomasochism, voyeurism and bisexuality are also portrayed.

88282: A corporate raider threatens a hostile take-over of a family company. The patriarch of the company enlists the help of his wife’s daughter, who is a lawyer, to protect the company. The raider is enamoured of her, and enjoys the thrust and parry of legal manoeuvring as he tries to win her heart.

151353: Rita has everything. 15 years and a whole summer ahead of her; a future ex-boyfriend and a best friend to braid her hair. But then, she visits an exhibition from a known neighbor, and her perfect world crumbles around her.

36371: Baron Munchausen will be permitted marriage only if he will give a written certification that all of his stories are lies and that he’s just an ordinary man.

77815: Undercover agent Chun Li seeks justice and peace in this action-packed adaptation of the megahit video game franchise Street Fighter — and with her signature high-kicking style, Chun Li is a force to be reckoned with.
Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li

17338: This is the story of a bomber crew who were shot down and the brave Dutch patriots who helped them home.
One of Our Aircraft Is Missing

28669: Queen Elizabeth thinks Michael Ingolby can do great things. Michael is mostly thinking about one of Elizabeth’s ladies in waiting, Cynthia. Soon his mind is on survival when Elizabeth sends him on a voyage to Spain.

16162: A suburban Chicago teenager’s parents leave on vacation, and he cuts loose. An unauthorized trip in his father’s Porsche means a sudden need for lots of money, which he raises in a creative way.

33341: A montage of women and appearances, a fantasy about beauty and the female, a fomage, a mirage. An attire satire.

2730: Seh-hee and Ji-woo have dated for two years; jealousy consumes her. She worries he will tire of her face. Then, she disappears. Telling no one, she goes to a plastic surgeon for a new face. Ji-woo has no idea where she is…

75794: Two girls with the same name but very different personalities share an apartment in this sequel to Nana. The rising fame of Nana Osaki’s band, the Black Stones, is beginning to take a toll on the best friends’ relationship.

17094: Modesty Blaise, a secret agent whose hair color and mod clothing change at a snap of her fingers is being used by the British government as a decoy in an effort to thwart a diamond heist. She is being set up by the feds but is wise to the plot and calls in sidekick Willie Garvin to outsmart them.

1947: In his attempts to reconcile a lounge singer with his mistress, a hapless talent agent is mistaken as her lover by a jealous gangster.

11103: On a lonely island in the Pacific Northwest, a group of travelers find themselves targeted by a crazed, homicidal family.

3916: The episodic film contains three short-films based on literary works by Hélder Prista Monteiro (“Os Imortais”), António Patrício (Suzy) and Agustina Bessa-Luís (Mãe de Um Rio).

12308: Carl needs the intervention of his beautiful wife Vicki  to keep his job, so Vicki meets with Carl’s boss Owens, and Carl’s job is secure. Insanely jealous, Carl finds Vicki with Owens on board a train and kills Owens. Jeff, an off-duty train engineer, protects Vicki and they begin an affair.

31310: American-born Gogol, the son of Indian immigrants, wants to fit in among his fellow New Yorkers, despite his family’s unwillingness to let go of their traditional ways.

96552: A whimsical tale of impossible love rendered in severely simplistic stick-figure technique.

1823: Mamlakat is an aspiring actress, sister to a mad brother who falls for the lies of an actor in a theater company passing through her village. After the guy promises to make her an actress, Mamlakat sleeps with him. He’s gone in the morning, but leaves behind undeniable proof of the night’s events…

2654: A contemporary story of love, sex and art, that follows the steadily intensifying relationship between Evelyn and Adam. As Evelyn strengthens her hold on Adam, his emotional and physical evolution discomforts his friends Jenny and Philip, with unexpected consequences for all.

239: A screenwriter hired by a pompous American, is torn between his own artistic expression and commercial success. His conflict parallels the disollution of his marriage as his wife becomes enamored with a rich playboy.

33225: A former Spanish Civil War prisoner, John McKittrick arrives in New York to find the truth behind the death of his friend Louie Lepetino. He finds himself being chased by Nazi agents who want an item he has brought back from Spain and cannot give up.

31274: Amidst a territorial gang-war, a sophisticated alien hunter stalks the citizens of Los Angeles and the only man between him and his prey is veteran LAPD officer, Lieutenant Mike Harrigan.

51959: Wealthy Max Fairbanks wakes one night to find Kevin Caffery robbing his house. Max swipes Kevin’s lucky ring and claims it as his own when he reports the crime.
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

3872: In this musical melodrama set against the backdrop of a workers’ strike in Nantes, a young woman wishes to leave her brutish husband for an earthy steelworker, though he is involved with another. Unbeknownst to the girl, the object of her affection boards with her no-nonsense baroness mother.

99935: For Anna Maria, paradise lies with Jesus, and she devotes her time to door-to-door missionary work.  One day after years of absence, her husband, an Egyptian Muslim confined to a wheelchair, comes home—and soon prayers are replaced by fighting…

21951: Shinjuku Thief is the story of a bookstore thief named Birdey who is led through various adventures in Tokyo’s Shinjuku district by salesgirl Umeko.

22726: Cardinal Richelieu and his power-hungry entourage seek to take control of seventeenth-century France, but need to destroy Father Grandier to do so. They seek to destroy him by setting him up as a warlock in control of a devil-possessed nunnery.

25897: Feature-length version of the documentary TV series “Planet Earth” (2006), following the migration paths of four animal families.

20777: Ranged across several generations, the story begins with a wealthy merchant, Lind, and his wife travelling in the coldest depths of winter to christen their baby daughter. Attacked by wolves, they lose the baby, which is found by the Lapp Jaampa and subsequently raised by a rich reindeer herder.

23900: This brilliantly chilling film is set in Prague during the Nazi occupation. It tells the story of Karl Kopfrkingl, a professional cremator, for whom the political climate allows free rein to his increasingly deranged impulses for the ‘salvation of the world’.

22642: During the year 2000 Geyrhalter and his teams traveled to a different destination each month, looking for places untouched by the millennium hysteria.

40142: An Evangelical Christian and a vet returning from Afghanistan work together at a tire shop.  With little to do during their empty days, they dance around their inner conflicts and cultural differences.

21835: She (Emmanuelle Devos) is almost deaf and she lip-reads. He (Vincent Cassel) is an ex-convict. She wants to help him. He thinks no one can help except himself.

44084: A typical apartment building in Budapest and their residents from the aspect of a young boy playing football sometime in the end of the 80’s at the time of the change of regime in Eastern Europe. Is there a way out from here? A geometrical paradox and a political parable at the same time.

21449: A filmmaker with a passion for vampire films and hard-core drugs struggles with his all-consuming obsessions.

20613: The tragic true story of Jean Charles de Menezes, the innocent Brazilian shot dead by British police in 2005 at the height of the London terrorist alerts.

99781: On a family vacation, a couple’s son and daughter disappear while exploring a cave-riddled mountainside. The children eventually return home seemingly unharmed, but are withdrawn and devoid of emotion…

26428: Animated short about a love between a heron and a crane. Based on a Russian folktale.

24805: After sending his giant bird, Rokh, to wreck Popeye’s boat and kidnap Olive Oyl, Sindbad forces Olive to dance for him by firing buckshot at her feet with a pea-shooter. Popeye attempts to rescue her…
Popeye the Sailor Meets Sindbad the Sailor

27672: Takako faces the after effects of the A-bomb when she travels around the city to call on old friends.

47123: Sexy Texas gal storms her way through life, brawling and boozing until her luck runs out, forcing her to learn the errors of her ways.

65361: A mystic stage performer called the Great Vorelli attempts to transfer a living soul into a wooden ventriloquist dummy. This classic horror film was produced by the great Richard Gordon and meshes unforgettable imagery with psychological terror.

24961: Ken Franklin is a rich socialite living in a luxurious coastal mansion bought from his years of writing crime and mystery books. However, what he once wrote as fiction becomes reality as he murders a man and then desperatly tries to cover up his crime

21681: The magnum opus of the independent filmmaker Ken Jacobs.  Begun in 1957 as a backyard bohemian romp starring the avant-garde legend Jack Smith, the project grew over the years to incorporate huge chunks of appropriated material…

43181: Tyrone (Danny Glover) is the proprietor of the Honeydripper juke joint. When business at the once-popular club begins to trail off and Tyrone hires unpredictable electric guitarist Sonny (Gary Clark Jr.) against his better judgment…

108323: The “Poems in 8mm”, digitally restored, are the first works of Franco Piavoli, made with a simple camera, no crew, no production. Surgery, 1952, “a joke”, “a game” without music and words, but already revealing an artistic sensibility that would soon be revealed in its fullness.

3521: After Bella recovers from the vampire attack that almost claimed her life, she looks to celebrate her birthday with Edward and his family…

32150: Experimental film by Hans Richter, Marcel Duchamp & Jean Cocteau released on March 15, 1957 in NYC. Featuring original music by Robert Abramson, John Gruen & Douglas Townsend.Described by Richter as “part Freud, part Lewis Carroll,” it is a fairy tale for the subconscious based on the game of chess.
8 X 8: A Chess-Sonata in Eight Movements

50650: The Care Bears live and play together in a country high in the clouds. But they also take care of the human children on Earth, that’s why they must stop an evil magician from removing all the caring in the world. The World is in trouble… and it’s up to the Care Bears to save it!

316: A widowed TV producer is invited to sit in on a mock casting audition in which young women audition for the “part” of his new wife.Leafing through the resumés in advance, his eye is caught by a striking ex-ballerina. Some grisly discoveries about his bride-to-be give him very, very cold feet.

36096: Shimizu’s early classic of independent Japanese cinema features a group of war orphans initially seen scratching out an existence through black market work, as they are taken under the wing of a nameless soldier, just repatriated after the war.

1570: Set in the countryside of the Province of Emilia in Italy, the story of two men, one a bastard born into a family of farm workers, the other an heir to a wealthy family of landowners.

272: When his long-lost brother resurfaces, Jacobo, desperate to prove his life has added up to something, looks to scrounge up a wife. He turns to Marta, an employee at his sock factory, with whom he has a prickly relationship.

1868: Arnold Schwarzenegger stars as Gordon Brewer, a Los Angeles firefighter who witnesses the deaths of his wife and child, innocent victims of a terrorist attack on a motorcade carrying Colombian dignitaries.

3445: Black Box Unlimited Worldwide Industries Incorporated employs Toe Thompson’s parents. But he isn’t entirely sold on this corporate conglomerate; all he wants is new friends. That wish comes true after Toe is struck by a mysterious rainbow-colored rock that falls right out of the sky.

1414: Marie gets out of prison – and can no longer stand to live between four walls. Baptiste comes from somewhere else, or so she says, and intends to live by her own rules.  They seem to be united by some indefinable bond, and soon they set off on a bizarre quest that neither can understand.

94548: Lucienne Delamare and Pierre Maury are having an affair. Lucienne’s husband Paul is the mayor, and a French deputy. Pierre’s wife Clotilde has been weak and sickly for years. Lucienne’s husband holds no excitement for her, and he is always away in Paris on business.

3839: A sensitive and powerful examination of the moral compromises made during World War II and the toll they take on families.

28896: Directed by Eduardo Coutinho and winner of The Grand Prize of Brazilian Cinema, this documentary recounts the story of 21 men and women workers who took part in the historic labor union strikes of 1979-80 in the metallurgic region called ABC in the State of Sao Paulo.

6475: Two rival motorcycle gangs terrorize a small town after one of their leaders is thrown in jail.

29960: A young composer has vivid dreams of the past that reflect, yet conflict with his waking life.

48017: Charles Wills, in Paris to cover the end of WWII, falls for Helen Ellswirth following a brief flirtation with her sister, Marion. After he and Helen marry, an old investment suddenly makes the family wealthy, and their marriage begins to unravel – until a sudden tragedy changes everything.
The Last Time I Saw Paris

31193: The safest way to travel is by air, but the FAA never figured the risk with Charles Rane on board. He’s the insane mastermind behind four recent terrorist attacks, and soon there will be a fifth, which is bad news for passengers on Flight 163. But there’s good news too: the man in seat 57.

28746: Leon travels the city streets with his trusty Leica, trying to capture the true heart of the city on film. puts him on the trail of Mahogany, a creepy butcher who rides the subway late at night.

17217: Harper is a cynical private eye in the best tradition of Bogart. He even has Bogie’s Baby hiring him to find her missing husband, getting involved along the way with an assortment of unsavory characters and an illegal-alien smuggling ring.

32398: In the Maranhao jungle of western Brazil, native people try to live according to their social norms despite government protections that often interfere with their way of life.

91578: It’s 1968. A tavern in İstanbul. The magnificent beauty Sabiha is singing on the stage. Halil can’t keep his eyes off of her…

110400: The clip consists almost solely of a closeup on Sinead O’Connor’s face as she sings the lyrics, sometimes with angry expression; the rest consists of her walking through an area of Paris, known as the Parc de Saint-Cloud.

37160: When a successful country lawyer captures and attempts to “civilize” the last remaining member of a violent clan that has roamed the Northeast coast for decades, he puts the lives of his family in jeopardy.

29804: In his socio-critical drama, debuting director Johannes Naber envisages his native Germany as a world which has no place for integrity, morality or innocence, at least not for young illegal immigrants.

35131: Eléonore Pourriat’s short is set in a world with a reverse gender power structure. Female joggers strut around topless, and men who wear short pants can expect to be harassed. On what seems to be just another ordinary day, a man is exposed to sexism and sexual violence in a society ruled by women.

29124: This is a film about you. Not about its maker.

153615: A delirious sci-fi riff on the Arabian Nights’ ‘Tale of the Hunchback’, that submerges us in a technological dystopia reigned by Dalaya.com, a mega-corporation that forces it’s employees to ‘relax’ at company-run medieval reenactments.

33986: When a high school party goes dangerously off the rails, one teenager finds that revenge is just a computer click away.

7217: When Virgil Cole and Everett Hitch arrive in Appaloosa, they find a town suffering at the hands of a rancher named Randall Bragg that means to own everything in it, and who has already left the city Marshall and one of his deputies dead.

36666: A group of good-hearted but incompetent misfits enter the police academy, but the instructors there are not going to put up with their pranks.

117291: The author Michel Houellebecq (playing himself) is abducted by three amateur kidnappers who bungle their efforts from start to finish.

1380: Marina de Van, a frequent collaborator of director François Ozon’s (she co-wrote several films with him, in addition to starring in See the Sea and Sitcom), makes her feature directorial debut with In My Skin, which she also wrote.

156891: Scarred Hearts is inspired by Romanian author Max Blecher’s novel, which is set in 1937. It centers on Emanuel, a man in his early 20s, who spends his days at a sanatorium on the Black Sea coast, suffering from bone tuberculosis.

4178: Jim Deakins is a frontiersman and Indian trader who is making a perilous journey with a group of other men up the Missouri River to get a large haul of furs from friendly Blackfoot Indians. The problem is that they have to get through hostile Indian territory first.

111262: The first act, set at a city intersection, tells the story of a young boy who was involved in a car crash. His hair turned white due to the force of the crash.

55258: Theater director Lloyd Fellowes is told he must bring a British hit play to the American stage with a cast including a feature actor, a washed-up star, a vacant leading man, a blond bombshell and a besotted character actor.

37558: Two youths meet in adolescence, and about ten years later, reconnect as adults, and though both have changed drastically, their love still remains.

30695: The Kingdom II: Part 2 - Birds of Passage

93075: Shows how a full carload of coal is loaded onto a vessel every thirty seconds at the great Erie Railroad Docks, Cleveland, Ohio. Great clouds of coal dust rise as each car is unloaded.

32914: Under provincial Italian law at the time, once a roof is erected, the occupants cannot be evicted from a building. This comedy follows the efforts of a family to erect the roof on a house overnight so that a newlywed couple can have their own home.

1148: The people of Kyrgyzstan have an ancient tradition: the parents of a large family offer a baby to a childless couple. One day, teenage Azate learns he is an adopted son. His once happy and carefree life is turned upside down.

34883: Simon, a young man with magic power, invokes the help of the evil forces in order to take revenge of a man who cheated him with a bad cheque.

2343: A depiction of life in wartime England during the Second World War. Director Humphrey Jennings visits many aspects of civilian life and of the turmoil and privation caused by the war, all without narration.

51032: Bullied by his siblings and nagged by his parents, 11-year-old Preston is fed up with his family — especially their frugality. But he gets his chance to teach them a lesson when a money-laundering criminal nearly bulldozes Preston with his car.

33732: A sobering mid-life crisis fuels dissatisfaction in Philip Dimitrius, to the extent where the successful architect trades his marriage and career in for a spiritual exile on a remote Greek island where he hopes to conjure meaning into his life…

3119: Marianne (Ullman), some thirty years after divorcing Johan (Josephson), decides to visit her ex-husband at his summer home. She arrives in the middle of a family drama between Johan’s son from another marriage and his granddaughter.

30945: Dalila (Ana Bustorff) is a middle-age, married woman who is still attractive, too attractive, for her rural husband—who is proud to show her off, but awfully jealous of her.

96121: The film is just this kind wandering through the personal ways and whys of different kinds of pain in different kinds of people. Far from the academic and the medical, the film questions this phenomenon of pain.

29288: A murderer begins killing off teenagers at a horrorthon they have organized in an abandoned theater.

33656: Conducting weird scientific experiments, crazed Dr. James Brewster, aided by his colleague Dr. Randall, has managed to transform himself into a hairy, stooped-over ape-man.

2227: Young lovers Sailor and Lula hit the road to start a new life together without the wrath of Lula’s deranged, disapproving mother, who has hired a team of hitmen to cut the lovers’ surreal honeymoon short.

17583: A master swordsman and former soldier and his hunchbacked assistant hunt vampires.

38508: One dark night a barrel containing a mysterious substance tumbles off a truck; suddenly a curious little cat is transformed into a lovely young woman with feline habits. Adopting the moniker Miss Minoes, our heroine befriends Tibbe, a shy bumbling cub reporter for the local newspaper.

24041: Mio’s death leaves husband Takumi and 6 year old son Yuji fending for themselves. Taku occasionally suffers fainting spells, is disorganized, and fears that his health hindered Mio’s happiness.

45936: A “happily” married bourgeois couple suddenly find their lives turned upside down when a breezy worker is hired to do some renovations in their apartment. In this light-hearted comedy, everyone finds a new life, and some have second thoughts.

103521: Five characters meet in a esplanade, beggining a journey trought their lifes.

20187: Charles Desvallées has good reasons to believe that his wife is cheating on him and hires a P.D. in order to prove himself right.

101570: Set in a dystopian future where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man’s effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy will lead to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world.

120945: A short film about traveling and staying at home.

44710: After three years of celibacy, at the climax of a one-night-stand, as Claire attempts to give herself up to passion and to deal with the awkwardness of intimacy – her daughter comes home early.

19541: Eliza D’Amico thinks her marriage to Louis is going great, until she finds a mysterious love note to her husband. Concerned, she goes to her mother for advice. Eliza, her parents, her sister Jo and Jo’s boyfriend all pile into a station wagon, to go to the city to confront Louis with the letter.

26010: Under the name Victor Chmara and a determination to “above all do nothing”,  a young deserter arrives at a well-to-do lakeside resort near the Swiss border. In a hotel foyer he meets the beautiful Yvonne.

103445: Guido and Antonia are a young couple with opposing characters and working schedules: he works a night job as a doorman in a hotel, and she works as an employee for a rental car service. This is the story of what happens to Guido and Antonia when they decide to have a child…

104788: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

45852: It’s spring, and Tom is much more interested in the female cat next door than in Jerry.

24125: An unscrupulous agent for the Borgias suffers a change of heart when asked to betray a noble count and his much younger, very beautiful wife.

46625: The video follows a day in the life of disaffected suburban teenagers driving around in a Dodge Charger.

41994: A young couple staying in an isolated vacation home are terrorized by three unknown assailants.

38810: A couple celebrates their wedding with a decadent soirée at the home of the bride’s sister. The wedding is a fiasco – not just because of the planet heading directly towards earth – that’s only an aside to the mounting family tension and tenuous relationship of the newlyweds.

98087: A high-school girl inherits a declining yakuza organisation, which seeks to repair its fortunes under her leadership. This mixture of deadpan comedy and outlandish action was a smash hit in Japan. A generation of young Japanese women grew up reciting lines of dialogue from this movie.

58091: While traveling in Auvergne, two young women, Anna and Françoise, unwillingly venture into the realm of Morgane, the Fairy Queen. Now, to go on living throughout the centuries, Morgane must obtain the souls of the ladies who cross her kingdom…
Girl Slaves of Morgana Le Fay

43615: Paris, today. A corrupt businessman, Duchey, returns to France to confront the justice of his country. But his return to his homeland will cause the turmoil of three individuals.

42833: Following the death of the Pope, the Conclave meets to elect his successor. A cardinal is chosen who seems unable to bear the weight of such a responsibility. Is it anxiety? Is it depression? Does he feel inadequate? The world is on tenterhooks as the faithful and the Church are kept in suspense.

41644: Upon taking her vows to become a nun, Sister Sarah is abused, brainwashed and drugged into submission by the corrupt clergy…

119337: When Warren Jeffs rose to Prophet of the Fundamentalist Church of Latter Day Saints, he took control of a religion with a history of polygamous and underage marriage. In a short time, Warren managed to expand these practices and the power of his position in unprecedented ways.

53028: Keiko, the Orca star of the Free Willy franchise, is back in this third adventure, which finds Willy happily acclimated to the ocean and having a child in the waters off the Pacific Northwest coast.

30572: An unsuccessful over-the-top actress becomes a successful over-the-top authoress in this biography of Jacqueline Susann.

111185: Apparent one shot sequence of the song being played in time to the actions of a giant Rube Goldberg machine built in a two-story warehouse from over 700 household objects, traversing an estimated half-mile course.

149048: Explores some of the Belgian filmmaker’s 40 plus films, and from Brussels to Tel Aviv, from Paris to New York, it charts the sites of her peregrinations.
I Don't Belong Anywhere: The Cinema of Chantal Akerman

3152: A suicidally disillusioned liberal politician puts a contract out on himself and takes the opportunity to be bluntly honest with his voters by affecting the rhythms and speech of hip-hop music and culture.

2308: An uptight English writer traveling to Crete on a matter of business finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

97254: In a freshwater pond, various aquatic creatures try to eat others in order to avoid being eaten themselves.

117176: My cheeks brush against the stones, I look out from a break in the wall.

3036: When Woody is stolen by an obsessive toy collector, Buzz Lightyear and the gang set out to rescue him. Afraid of the fate that awaits him when Andy grows up, Woody is tempted by the idea of immortality in a museum.

28335: Gabriel and Gabriela have been happily married for 20 years but their sexual desire for each other no longer exists. Is this all life has to offer?

4057: Ewen Bremner and Chloe Sevigny star in this portrait of the effects of schizophrenia on family life.

35426: Mysterious barrels bounce off an Army transport and land near an abandoned cemetery. Mischievous boys discover the barrels and open them, releasing the green vapor that turns the living into zombies and awakens the dead. All of the living dead search for living victims… to devour their brains!
Return of the Living Dead Part II

113278: This colourful first fiction by renowned producer Minarro offers a quietly hallucinating take on the brief rule of Amadeo of Savoy, who was king of turbulent Spain for two years around 1870.

The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian

28251: Bean works as a caretaker at Britain’s formidable Royal National Gallery, and his bosses want to fire him because he sleeps at work all the time, but can’t because the chairman of the gallery’s board defends him.

37513: Friends of the recently deceased Quincas take their pal’s body on one last tour of his favorite spots in Brazil’s Bahia.
The Two Deaths of Quincas Wateryell

42404: Inspector Betti (Maurizio Merli) is transferred to Naples and immediately after his arrival receives a warm welcome from The Commandante (Barry Sullivan), the city’s crime lord.

40829: Based on the Internet comic strip, Multi-Cell Girl (a.k.a Dasepo sonyo) follows the sexual adventures in one seriously bizarre high school.

105635: Short, experimental animation by Simone Massi.

22355: Germany 1939. Hans and Lene marry the day before the war breaks out. During a bombing raid their daughter Anna is born. Hans survives the war but he is not the same person as in 1939, and he and Lene find it difficult to live together again.

45501: The two missionaries came into conflict with the authorities when they turned their missionary into a parrot farm. The Bishop of Maracaibo calls them his ‘black sheep’ and the Monsignore has been called to check on their behavior.

9056: Young love is poisoned by a generations long feud between two noble families.

47434: H.P. Lovecraft finds the Necronomicon and transcribes three of the stories within.

25334: Woton Wretchichevsky has a disfigured face, dresses in cloak and mask and stalks couples to burn them with a blowtorch. He is also a sculptor of steel and garbage installations.

Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie

Hugh Hefner: Playboy, Activist and Rebel

42046: After his brother dies of a gold chain overdose, Jack Spade attempts to avenge his death.

6520: The plot concerns schoolteachers Karen Wright and Martha Dobie, both of whom are in love with Dr. Joe Cardin. The malicious lie of one of their students involves all three in a scandal which disrupts all their lives.

28613: Seyyit Khan: Bride of the Earth

96684: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, becomes overprotective of the establishment when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the count’s teen-aged daughter.

96528: The UNKLE song’s accompanying music video, directed by Jonathan Glazer and starring actor Denis Lavant, was widely acclaimed for its direction and cinematography, and won numerous awards.

Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi

George Carlin: You are All Diseased

Once Upon a Time in America

12372: The relationship between an aspiring dancer and a popular songstress provides a retrospective of the great African American entertainers of the early 1900s.

104102: Ethan longs to escape his small Southern town. He meets a mysterious new girl, Lena. Together, they uncover dark secrets about their respective families, their history and their town.

23462: In a series of vignettes that serve as a sequel to Amici Miei, director Mario Monicelli brings back several of his stars from the earlier movie to continue their antics in Florence, home of the friends of the title. All five are (or in some cases, were) close companions and have a penchant for pract

119775: The group NWA emerges from the streets of Compton, California in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes pop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.

24567: Institute Benjamenta, or This Dream People Call Human Life

26452: This is a German made-for-TV movie based on Kafka’s book. As the first film produced on The Metamorposis, it could reveal as an interesting comparison of narrative structure and theme.

22594: Covering the same historical period as The Red and the White from within Hungary itself, Silence and Cry’s opening montage tracks the very quick downfall of Bel Kun’s postwar Communist takeover.

4696: Norman’s quietude is again in jeopardy when a fallen nun checks in at the Bates Motel and a nosy reporter starts to investigate the disappearence of Norman’s former co-worker.

112787: A promising, young music student who specializes in the drums enters a highly competitive conservatory where he clashes with a verbally abusive instructor, played by J.K. Simmons in an Oscar-winning turn.

28988: Junkies wander around abandoned, rubble-strewn Manhattan lots, then we see a mushroom cloud. Again scored to a Swans song.

3927: This film presents a single banal problem (how to sneak onto the Paris Metro) with several comic solutions.

15358: Sally Potter is being courted by Hollywood after the success of her last film, but she longs for the freedom of dance. Pablo Veron is a brilliant tanguero but fears that dance leaves no trace.

32286: A sheriff sees his state senate bid slide out onto the ice when his daughter begins to date the son of a charming but psychologically disturbed woman with whom the sheriff has engaged in a two-decades-long affair.

5760: This wildly off-beat comedy is about a male dancer who refuses to follow the accepted rules of ballroom dancing and creates his own style of choreography, which infuriates the ballroom dancing establishment

116489: Suspense film and psychological investigation in narrow space of the cabin of a trailer, carrying a giant piece from its production place to a large mining site; two men, vehicle drivers, and a young woman, crossing a path that leads to know each other and to better understand their own biography.

34275: A wife and mother passes away, and spirit returns in her daughter’s body.

3793: The stories of three men working at the Bosphorus Bridge in Istanbul are told by the original characters, in this mosaic depicting real persons exposing their lives and aspirations.

29566: Paul, 16-years-old, turns up uninvited to visit his relatives. Having recently lost his father, Paul is searching for an ideal world, and he intrudes upon the seemingly ideal family.

91502: A little girl called Ana went to buy some bread. In addition to her shopping basket, she also took an umbrella as it was raining. But the wind lifted the umbrella into the air, taking Ana with it.
Ana Goes To Buy Some Bread

33898: A very old woman wants to have dinner with her friends. As they are all dead, the butler has to play the role of every guest.

77060: When Sean Arthur, an unmotivated young man who hustles counterfeit merchandise in New York City, meets seasoned street-fighting coach Harvey Boarden by chance, his whole life changes.

15760: An exotic religious cult is in the middle of its annual sacrificing of a young nymph when they realize that the girl is not wearing the sacrificial ring, and it’s on the finger of Ringo Starr. The Beatles must remove the ring from Ringo’s finger and return it to the cult, thus avoiding death.

92255: A portrait of famed Chilean singer and folklorist Violeta Parra filled with her musical work, her memories, her loves and her hopes.

36778: In a Yorkshire mining town, three educated brothers return to their blue-collar home to celebrate the 40th wedding anniversary of their parents, but dark secrets come to the fore.

My Heart Is That Eternal Rose

57317: Major Ram Prasad Sharma yearns to see project Mission Milaap come to fruition and usher in an era of peace between two warring countries. But the evil Raghavan will do anything to stop the peace process.

1056: Longing for human contact Xiao Wu tries all he can to make a connection through physical and metaphorical walls in that hour between night and day.

3007: A hunted man breaks into the castle at Oberwald to kill the Queen, but faints before doing so. He is Sebastian, the splitting image of the King who was assassinated on his wedding day.

95234: Inititated by the Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival, twenty outstanding Taiwanese directors were each asked to create one five-minute short film inspired by the same topic: the uniqueness of their country.

25305: After Miss Marple is made a trustee of a merchant marine training vessel, a fellow trustee is poisoned, and ship’s officers are later murdered after she comes on board.

61781: Belle, the Beast, Lumiere, Cogsworth and the rest of those zany castle residents use their imaginations to embark on three magical, storybook adventures. This direct-to-video anthology serves as a “sequel” to Disney’s animated hit film.
Beauty and the Beast: Belle's Magical World

9103: A group of Los Angeles teenagers meet every day at their local diner hangout to discus their latest misadventures with their miserable lives.

80516: Death seems to follow Clay Birdwell, a small-town Montanan who tries to end an affair with a woman after her husband — his best friend — commits suicide. But the death toll climbs even higher when Clay forges a friendship with a serial killer.

19947: Uncle Buck has a reputation for being unreliable and a bit of a house wrecker. It is therefore with reluctance, his sister-in-law agrees to leave Buck looking after the kids (two harmless youngsters and a rebelious teenager) when she visits her sick father.

104696: On a cold winter’s day Sergey Sobolev, a major at the local police office, is driving to the hospital where his wife is about to give birth to their child.

25261: Superman battles a criminal mastermind and his robot army.

47561: A teenage alien tries to abduct a sleeping human, but with so many switches to do so, it’s nearly impossible.

103927: A group of unwitting teens are stranded near a strange wax museum and soon must fight to survive and keep from becoming the next exhibit.

27230: Work causes a single mother to move to China with her young son; in his new home, the boy embraces kung fu, taught to him by a master.

100750: Just before night descends upon him for good, a man is asked to babysit…

125573: CIA employee Edward Snowden leaks thousands of classified documents to the press.

24397: After the death of her daughter, Julia Lofting, a wealthy housewife, moves to London to re-start her life. All seems well until she is haunted by the sadness of losing her own child and the ghosts of other children.

87577: Bachir Lazhar, an Algerian immigrant, is hired to replace a primary school teacher who has suffered a tragic death. As the class embarks on a long healing process, nobody at the school suspects Bachir’s painful past, or that he fears being deported at any moment.

39484: Ronya, a 10-year-old girl who lives quite happily in her father’s castle and has no problems until she comes across Birk, a playmate encountered in the dark and fascinating forest near the castle.

20335: A zany and sumptuously animated tale about a reckless train ride from award-winning animator Cordell Barker.

40464: A harried, burned-out cop believes that a recent string of murders prove that the murderer might be a deer-like creature in the form of a beautiful woman right from a local Native America folklore legend.

32841: A boy who is captured by a cannibal tells her three horror stories to avoid becoming her victim.
Tales from the Darkside: The Movie

33667: A bio-doc about Micheline Presle changes into a thrilling investigation of the long hidden truth about European cinema. This mockumentary thriller uncovers Hollywood’s unsuspected plot against the European motion picture industry.

109414: An ascii animation of a scene from the famous pornographic movie Debbie Does Dallas.

73325: A group of hippies step from a thunderstorm into a nightmare. The villa where they seek refuge seems vacant, but they soon discover that it’s the site of satanic rituals. After witnessing a bloody sacrifice, the group flees in terror, only to find themselves becoming the accused…

4381: Financier J.B. Ball (Edward Arnold) — known in the press as “the Bull of Broad Street” — may be one of the wealthiest investment bankers in the country, but he also knows the value of a dollar.

88874: A man abandons modern civilization and lives in a secluded cabin on a snowy mountain, sending mail bombs to corporate CEOs. One day, a mysterious creature appears before him…

15487: A motivational speaker discovers that the inheritance his father left for him is in the form of an elephant.

3128: S., an apprentice baker in a country town, leaves his father’s bakery after a violent argument. That evening, he spends the night with a young waitress. While she is sleeping, he steals all her saving. This marks the start of life for a small-time thief and his gang: murder and transformation.

30974: Having fled from former Yugoslavia, the lives of three powerful women cross in Switzerland, where they learn to re-evaluate themselves. Devoid of any easy nostalgia, the film touches on the pain that is inevitably linked to an involuntary break with your own past.

50259: This is the delightful story of a master toymaker who discovers a magical kingdom of elves at the North Pole. There he is entrusted with special powers. But one of his elves goes to work for a greedy toy baron who wants to put Santa out of business.

28187: A model named Barbara Hallen has disappeared and her father gets private detective Sam Morgan to go to Paris to find his daughter.

2372: This brutal crime drama that swept the César Awards stars Tahar Rahim in a breakthrough performance as a young illiterate Arab man who becomes a Mafioso heavyweight while serving time in a French prison.

3284: A tale about a strange young man, Bulcsú, his fellow inspectors, who are all without exception likeable characters, a rival ticket inspection team, and racing along the tracks…and a tale about love.

4149: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

29071: The comic story of a dodgeball championship. Under the painful tutelage of legendary ADAA champ Patches O’Houlihan, Peter LaFleur and his Average Joes take on the Purple Cobras, led by egomaniacal fitness guru White Goodman.

91015: Betty, Bimbo and Koko are the owners of a traveling medicine show.

5313: A group of 12 teenagers from various backgrounds enroll at the American Ballet Academy in New York to make it as ballet dancers and each one deals with the problems and stress of training and getting ahead in the world of dance.

131040: A young woman’s desperate search for her abducted boyfriend that draws her into the infamous Colonia Dignidad, a sect nobody ever escaped from.

34762: 26 men are chosen to participate in the roles of guards and prisoners in a psychological study that ultimately spirals out of control.

37569: Reporter Nick Mullen “stumbles” on a story that links a prominent member of Parliament to a KGB agent and to a near nuclear disaster involving a teenage runaway and an American airbase.

111253: The characters are featured in the music video as two cyberspace kids who escape to a world of virtual reality together, both not realizing the other is also doing virtual reality.

35944: An office worker inadvertently becomes a hero after he saves a woman’s life.

34606: As the group of elite Brazilian intellectuals debate the most effective method for enacting their plans, they are discovered and imprisoned by the Portuguese crown…

32791: When 2 detectives steal $80,000 from a dead robber, one of them suffers from a guilty conscience which could lead to murder.

29115: After a collision with a comet, a nearly 8km wide piece of the asteroid “Orpheus” is heading towards Earth.

21040: A group of people who know each other, perhaps work together, are cinematically transported to a spot halfway between a large tent on a science fiction desert and the ballroom of a submarine, in a film about doubt, full-fledged doubt.

87940: When I grow up, I’ll be a Kangaroo comprises three intertwined stories set in the Belgrade suburb of Voždovac: a date at the cinema, bets placed on a football game, and a strange occurance in the sky.
When I Grow Up, I'll Be a Kangaroo

25186: A young, jobless woman stays in bed, reads, talks on the phone, smokes cigarettes, makes fresh coffee, and tries on some clothes from a large wardrobe.

23011: As serial killer Lothar Schramm lies dying in a pool of his own blood, choppy memories of his horrific life flash before his eyes.
Schramm: Into the Mind of a Serial Killer

23175: Fishing village girl Ling Ling sets off to look for her cousin in Shanghai. She soon finds out that Shanghai is a city full of vice: she is raped, sold into prostitution, and later becomes a socialite who uses her earnings to help others.

41675: One fine morning the police break in crooked antique dealer Alfredo’s apartment and bring him to the police station: he is accused of the murder of Adalgisa de Matteis, an ex-mistress of his. During the long and painful interrogation, he remembers some obscure fragments of his past.

80795: Perseus embarks on a treacherous quest into the underworld to rescue Zeus, who has been targeted for capture by his traitorous son, Ares, and his brother, Hades.

46614: Inspired to live a different kind of life, a Manhattan couple move to a commune and embrace hippie culture.

79345: Clever update of the teens-lost-in-the-woods horror subgenre finds a quintet of American teenagers trapped in a mysterious cabin where nothing is quite what it seems.

22083: In The Romantics, seven close friends—all members of a tight, eclectic college clique—reconvene at a deluxe seaside wedding to watch two of their own tie the knot.

60590: Funnyman Tim Allen plays an out-of-practice superhero who used to turn heads as the flashy Captain Zoom. When a secret agency recruits him to turn a motley crop of teens into the next generation of good guys, he’s forced to get back into shape.

19414: A teenage girl on vacation in the Bahamas with her divorced father tries to impress a potential boyfriend by saying that her father is actually her lover.

38821: Rivaldo Torres and Teodoro Xavier are poets and childhood friends. They release their book with a launch party in downtown São Paulo and invite a variety of characters to the event, including a potential suicide victim saved by Torres, pimps, prostitutes, and homeless people.

43588: When you get married, you’re not just getting a husband or wife—you get the family, the friends, even the exes. Buzzy and Katy are newlyweds.

44645: Antoine, 8 years old, has lost his father in a plane crash. Unable to accept his death, he finally starts living again and accept his loss through a metaphorical dream. And thus, he’s able to grieve.

118394: I Predict is a song by Sparks. It was released in 1982 as the only single from Angst in My Pants. A music video made to accompany the single featured Ron Mael in drag doing a striptease. The video was directed by David Lynch.

38539: Michael Bauer (Klaus Salge) is a character living in Berlin who has appeared in other films by the Iranian director Sohram Shahid Saless, but now he is grown up, working as a butcher, frustrated in love, and slowly going insane.

24070: In Manila, 20-year-old Iliac and his attractive male co-workers give massages and a whole lot more to their gay clientele. When Iliac’s philandering father passes away, the young man must reconcile his career as a sex worker with his role as son and brother to his grieving Mom and siblings.

20397: Broke, and armed with only a glass of wine and a wry sense of humor, middle-aged Gianni resides with his 93-year-old mother in their ancient apartment. The condo debts are mounting, but if Gianni looks after the building manager’s mother during the Pranzo di Ferragosto, all will be forgiven…

26200: A hard-working young man meets and falls in love with his sister’s bridesmaid. He soon finds out how disturbed she really is.

24251: A relationship between Hélène and Gilles blossoms after she nearly runs him over with his car.

26364: The story is about a journey to find a true love by four guys, Agus, Doni, Olip and Bimo, who lived and study in Bandung. It’s about love, commitment of love and asking what the responsibility of love is. All wrap in drama comedy genre, but not like slapstick comedy.

19635: For those for whom a film cannot be crazy enough. A kind of Thai James Bond operates cheerfully and cross-dressed. Lots of mad dressing up, insane adventures and the necessary winks at the Thai genre film.

102873: During a sweltering summer in New York City, 14-year-old Mister’s hard-living mother is apprehended by the police, leaving the boy and nine-year-old Pete alone to forage for food while dodging child protective services and the destructive scenarios of the Brooklyn projects.
The Inevitable Defeat of Mister and Pete

39426: A Turkish comedy film starring Ata Demirer as a young clarinet player who struggles to win back his fiance after she moves to a small village in the Turkish countryside, which is a sequel to the hit comedy Eyyvah Eyvah (2010).

104598: In the sixteenth century, somewhere in the Cevennes, Michael Kohlhaas, a successful horse dealer leads a wealthy and happy family life. Victim of an injustice, this pious and upright man raised an army and put the bag cities to restore his rights.
Age of Uprising: The Legend of Michael Kohlhaas

23354: A voyage into the Himalayas with the great mountain climber Reinhold Messner.  What makes this undertaking all the more extraordinary is the fact that the two climbers set off on their expedition without oxygen tanks and without high-altitude base camps, taking only their backpacks with them.
The Dark Glow of the Mountains

46799: Word of a monster ape ten stories tall living in the Himalayas reaches fortune hunters in Hong Kong.

21305: A group of girls and boys in their twenties settle in a country house that seems completely isolated from civilization. One of them writes a novel while the others try to become a gang and prepare a robbery; some fall in love, or seem to be, or believe (or say) they are in love.

41530: The miniseries explores the public and personal life of the Virgin Queen, as played by Helen Mirren during the last half of her rule, taking a personal look at her friends, enemies and suitors and how she survived a male-dominated world.

36476: A road movie where no one is ever seen on the road, this striking, unconventional feature detours from genre conventions as it follows two Floridian teenaged girls on a journey fraught with sexual mystery and suppressed desire.

1190: In this early stop-motion film by Czech surrealist Jan Svankmajer, a device consisting of a clock, a pendulum, a faucet and a bucket enacts a series of events whenever the clock chimes.

29334: The sometimes frightening, sometimes suspenseful, and somewhat funny story of a mother whose life has been shaped by the moral judgment of the middle-class and the young man forced to live in his mothers hell.

113147: A band of samurai set out to avenge the death and dishonor of their master at the hands of a ruthless shogun.

34427: The subject of the work is earthly predestination: a predetermined, immutable future that will unfold before mankind. Humans will be watching, passively and helplessly, as it unfurls – as if they are passengers on a giant ship.

55048: Brad is a rap star wanna-be who hails from Malibu but acts and talks as if he’s from the ‘hood. Problem is, Brad’s uptight Republican dad is running for governor of California and is worried that his son will embarrass him during the campaign.

133230: A modern prophet’s visions of mythical destruction and transformation are recounted across a turbulent geometric ceremony of rising curtains, swirling setpieces, and unveiled idols from music television’s past.

15976: An updated version of H.G Wells’ seminal sci-fi classic about the an alien invasion threatening the future of humanity. The catastrophic nightmare is depicted through the eyes of one American family fighting for survival.

692: Elizabeth sends telegrams to her old boyfriend Ben in New York and to her younger sister Leo in Rome to join her in Paris, where she is selling her dead father’s estate. When Ben and Leo arrive, a mysterious adventure begins.

5132: The end of the 19th century. Lasse and his son Pelle move to Denmark and find employment at a large farm, but are treated as the lowest form of life and are harassed for being foreigners. But none of them wants to give up their dream of finding a better life than the one they left in Sweden.

35719: The long-haired Princess Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but when she falls in love with a bandit who was passing by she must venture into the outside world for the first time to find him.

4368: The film records the removal of furniture and objects from the building, leaving visitors able to move freely amongst its empty spaces and a silence charged with feeling.

16701: When Susanne Wallner returns home from a concentration camp in 1945, she finds the city of Berlin in total ruins. What’s more, the traumatized and cynical surgeon Dr. Mertens has occupied her apartment and refuses to leave.

29250: A parody of Warner Bros.’ 1936 film, “The Green Pastures” which tells of an ersatz Heaven called “Pair-O-Dice” and its angels’ efforts to win souls from “Hades Inc.”

33522: Taking Rome as a backdrop and Roman culture as a target; Rocha is mixing opera, documentary film and experimental cinema.

2153: When a wealthy baron decides the time has come for his prudish nephew to take a wife, the terrified young man opts to buy a lifelike, mechanized doll and marry it instead, hoping no one will be the wiser.  But the doll has a secret of its own…

3309: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.

6095: Welsh writer Tyvian Jones seems to have it all, Sixties-style — an international best-seller, an apartment in Rome, a gorgeous fiancée — but remains dissatisfied. He soon meets his perfect match in the cool, calculating Eve…

1358: Based on actual events, this elegantly-shot feature explores the relationship between a Victorian surgeon and a severely deformed man being exploited at a carnival freak show.

31573: Jessie is an ageing career criminal who has been in more jails, fights, schemes, and lineups than just about anyone else. His son Vito, while currently on the straight and narrow, has had a fairly shady past and is indeed no stranger to illegal activity.

942: Jacques Becker lovingly evokes the Belle epoque Parisian demimonde in this classic tale of doomed romance. When gangster’s moll Marie (Simone Signoret) falls for reformed criminal Manda (Serge Reggiani), their passion incites an underworld rivalry that leads inexorably to treachery and tragedy.

29098: A re-enactment torn straight from the headlines of April 12, 1897: the Greek town of Tyrnavos is overrun by Turks.

114126: Oppressed by her family setting, dead-end school prospects and the boys law in the neighborhood, Marieme starts a new life after meeting a group of 3 free-spirited girls. She changes her name, her dress code, and quits school to be accepted in the gang, hoping that this will be a way to freedom.

2037: Ahmed El Maanouni’s 1981 documentary records concerts, interviews and behind-the-scenes glimpses of the pioneering group, Nass El Ghiwan, which has been famously described by Martin Scorsese as ‘the Rolling Stones of North Africa’.

826: Winner of the Special Jury Prize at Cannes and nominated for two Oscars, this arthouse classic depicts the strange and unusual relationship that forms between an amateur entomologist and a woman who lives at the bottom of a sand dune.

89473: The film is set in southern Georgia, which until the end of XIX century was dominated by the Ottoman Empire.

31417: Fabio Testi stars as Luca Di Angelo, an idealistic family man and cigarette smuggler in the treacherous Naples underworld. But when a rival gang massacres his brother and abducts his wife, Luca triggers a psychotic mob war in this depraved, often-censored shocker.

134335: The story of Florence Foster Jenkins, a New York heiress, who dreamed of becoming an opera singer, despite having a terrible singing voice.

48593: Funnyman Eddie Murphy portrays the titular San Francisco doc who regains his childhood gift for conversing with critters when he hits his head on the windshield of his car. Soon, his new ability leads to a business opportunity.

88629: After several cycles of chemotherapy, fourteen-year-old Donald (Thomas Brodie-Sangster) feels he has little left to hope for.

37580: In the wake of Israel’s 2006 bombardment of Lebanon, a determined woman finds her way into the country convincing a taxi cab driver to take a risky journey around the scarred region in search of her sister and her son.

105425: This film is about a group of rank-and-file Japanese soldiers jailed for crimes against humanity.

158674: Africa. In the wild expanses, where bushbucks, impalas, zebras, gnus and other creatures graze by the thousands, they are on holiday. German and Austrian hunting tourists drive through the bush, lie in wait, stalk their prey. A vacation movie about killing, a movie about human nature.

25288: Running away from the police, Aden goes to the desert where he meets an uncivilized man who has a special link with Mother Earth. He ends up by convincing the hermit to come along with him into another desert: the big town.
I Will Walk Like a Crazy Horse

18788: The Roth family lead a quiet life in a small village in the German Alps during the early 1930’s. When the Nazi’s come to power, the family is divided and Martin Brietner, a family friend is caught up in the turmoil.

41863: A teenager stumbles upon an alien weapon, which transform him into a grotesque killer.

26083: Harold Van Pelham (Lloyd) is a hypochondriac, rich businessman who sails to the tropics for his ‘health.’ Instead of the peace and seclusion he is seeking, he finds himself in the middle of a revolution.

126841: This animation follows the childhood adventures of a girl named Heidi, who lives with her grandfather somewhere on the Alps.

118252: The story of one man’s love life is seen through the eyes of his best friend and dog, Winston, and revealed bite by bite through the meals they share.

22021: The first feature film from "Kazakh new wave“ film director Darezhan Omirbaev tells the story of a young man from a village in Kazakh steppe and his initiation into life in the big city.

41907: This astonishingly little seen documentary about Portugal’s second largest city, Porto, is a tribute by Manoel de Oliveira to the city of his childhood, where the director masterly interweaves fact and fiction together.

42770: The story concerns a young boy named Emil who has been packed off to visit relatives in Germany. While en route on the train, Emil’s money is stolen by a penny-ante thief. The boy enlists the aid of a group of pre-teen youths who fancy themselves ace detectives.

47890: One of the most important early British films in that it was one of the first to deliberately exploit the contrast between the eye of the camera and of the audience watching the final film.

43686: A cowardly boy who buries himself in accident statistics enters a library to escape a storm only to be transformed into an animated illustration by the Pagemaster. He then has to work his way through a series obstacles from classic books in order to return to real life.

21186: Sebastian is eleven years old. He lives at home with his mother and is pretty smart for your age. From an elevated spot in the playground, he surveys his neighbourhood. Sebastian works as a connection point between the characters in the neighbourhood.

46966: Originally filmed to be a part of New York, I Love You (2009), but edited out of the final, finished print.

27011: While on holiday in Venice, an English couple on the verge of separating find themselves inexplicably drawn to a mysterious local and his long-suffering wife.

120762: When a diabolical pirate steals the secret Krabby Patty formula, SpongeBob and his nemesis Plankton must team up in order to get it back.
The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water

65502: John Cusack stars in Harold Ramis’s outlandish holiday thriller as Charlie Arglist, an unethical dim-bulb attorney who teams up with his shifty associate to embezzle $2 million from a local mobster.

39811: For years an underground war has raged for dominance over the town of Frazier Park between two clans. Dominance isn’t determined through fistfights or petty brawls, but the dancing video game Beat-Beat Revelation.

25124: Trapped in an unhappy marriage, the wife of a high ranking Fascist official starts a dangerous, self-destructive relationship with a duplicitous S.S. Officer.

47624: Jaga Bada, Mr. Satan’s old sparring partner, has invited Satan to his personal island to hold a grudge match. Trunks and Goten decide to come for the adventure and Android #18 is following Satan for the money he owes her. But Jaga Bada’s scientist resurrected Brolly, the legendary Super Saiyajin…

3342: A group of medical students unloads an ample supply of beer and there is nothing to indicate that their stay at a mountain cabin won’t be utterly relaxing. Except perhaps a Nazi unit that froze to death nearby during the Second World War.

32733: A young couple who live in the overcrowded world of East End tower blocks and bomb sites are annoyed at not being able to be alone together.

89920: Film school grad Nick Chapman thought his career was made after his award winning short film, but discovered Hollywood wasn’t as easy as it seems.

90389: Eccentric pastel bright comedy from Norway about middle age, OCD and… the sport of curling!

97044: Anna and his son, Sanjay live in a small town. Anna is a train-driver and works for the railways. One day his train meets with an accident and his right leg becomes paralyzed. When Sanjay grows up, Anna gets him a job with the railways as a ticket inspector.

575: This iconic, influential thriller centers around two women, a cruel boarding school headmaster’s wife and younger mistress, who plot together to murder him and hide the body in the school’s out-of-season pool, only to find the body go missing shortly thereafter.

33569: Samantha Hughes, a teenaged Kentucky girl, never knew her father, who died in Vietnam before her birth.

31538: When a brothel closes because of new laws, four of the prostitutes decide to go into business running a restaurant. They discover they cannot escape their past.

30762: A young genius frantically races against time to crack an enemy code and solve the mystery surrounding the woman he loves.

35882: Snow’s ambitious attempt at exploring the formal intricacies and artificialities of the sound cinema.
Rameau's Nephew' by Diderot (Thanx to Dennis Young) by Wilma Schoen

97120: Best friends Nick (Alex Karpovsky) and Darryl (Tarik Lowe) are a film editing power duo hired to rework a movie in crisis. But what should have been business as usual has taken them into a personal tailspin of their own…

31820: In an apartment, four young girls daydream about a hypothetical boy while, in front of their building, the construction of a mosque comes to an end…

32657: A male advice columnist, under the pseudonym “Miss Lonely Hearts”, is drawn into the lives of the people he offers advice to.

16582: A critically-injured woman is taken to the plastic surgery clinic of Doctor Dan Keloid, where some of her intact tissue is treated to become “morphogenetically neutral”. The woman’s body develops an orifice under her armpit, within which hides a phallic stinger.

1277: Moscow 1998. Rita is on the run because her boyfriend can’t pay his mafia gambling debts. Jaja, a deaf nightclub dancer, offers Rita a place to hide. Rita finds herself involved in another kind of underground society – that of the deaf.

30606: “New York, N.Y.” won the César Award for best short documentary in 1986.

33871: Six former college friends, with two new friends, gather for a New Years Eve weekend reunion at a large English countryside manor after ten years to reminisce about the good times now long gone.

36791: A story told with few words. We see a solitary man and a solitary woman, each alone with their thoughts. She is in the country, staring out a window. Nature is quiet, waiting for spring, trees are bare. He is in the city, walking from the docks, watching, somewhat aimless.

28125: A cellist in a small orchestra receives help from animals to help him practice his music.

36841: In the 1960s, a group of friends at an all girls school learn that their school is going to be combined with a nearby all boys school. They concoct a plan to save their school while dealing with everyday problems along the way.

49852: Wes Craven produces this reinvention of Bram Stoker’s classic horror story. After breaking into a high-security vault, a team of thieves discovers an ancient crypt that holds none other than the corpse of Dracula.

4247: 13-year-old Gunther Strobbe grows up surrounded by alcohol, trash and his completely useless father and uncles. Slowly but surely, he’s being prepared for the same hapless life. Can he defy his destiny?

108788: This bold adaptation of Émile Zola’s sordid novel of adultery and murder in 19th-century Paris places the talented Elizabeth Olsen in the title role, engaging our sympathies and our revulsion in equal measure, until the satisfyingly grim finale.

31694: An undercover cop infiltrates a gang of thieves who plan to rob a jewelry store.

37703: Former high school musical star, Marc Pease, finds himself still living in the past, eight years after graduating.

6372: The fiend faces the spectacular mind-bending consequences of his free-wheeling rarebit binge.

4323: Despite leading a regular life with his wife and three children, one day in the year 2092, Nemo Nobody wakes up as a mortal centenarian foggily telling a reporter his life story.

35752: A young peasant, with no interest in adventure or fortune, is mistaken as the kingdom’s only hope when a horrible monster threatens the countryside.

90025: It tells the story of a brother and sister who live under a family curse.
The Fall of the House of Usher

28041: A former judo champion quits the tournament cirucit and runs a nightclub. However, when a new challenger appears as well as an old rival and a judo master in need of reviving his school, the young man must go back in training and prepare for the ultimate challenge.
