44120: A retelling of the old story with Donald Duck and Peter Pig unwilling to help the Wise Little Hen with her crops.

27806: Film on an amateur orchestra consisting of tram drivers, technicians, mechanics who meet and play twice a week.

24671: A sloppy drunk, Sam succumbs to the temporary solace of Anna, a mysterious woman with whom he shares sultry nights on the streets. But as their passion mounts, his health declines and his hangovers take on an hallucinogenic horror, as he becomes convinced Anna is a vampire.

21991: The story begins with Shun, a shy 17-year-old boy, taking pretty young Nanami  to a hotel room. We are primed for a garden-variety “sexual awakening” scene. Instead, Shun and Nanami spend the night talking about their lives.
Nanami: The Inferno of First Love

25787: An investigation of a horse-racing scam leads 007 to a mad industrialist who plans to create a worldwide microchip monopoly by destroying California’s Silicon Valley.

104370: A short avant-garde film by Hollis Frampton.

20867: The day after the funeral of Varlam Aravidze, the mayor of a small Georgian town, his corpse turns up in his son’s garden and is secretly reburied. But the corpse keeps returning, and the police eventually capture a local woman, who is accused of digging it up.

23610: In this first chapter we get acquainted with Vinni-Pukh and suspicious bees.

119463: Guided by Easychord’s haunting, bodily piece, the visuals attempt to explore and invoke the concepts of prisoner’s cinema, stream of consciousness, repetition, the primordial body, fundamental entities, and astral planes.

43141: A pair of Americans want to perform the greatest robbery: the treasure of San Genaro, in Napoli.

21641: In this magnificently inscrutable late-sixties masterpiece, Marco Ferreri, one of European cinema’s most idiosyncratic auteurs, takes us through the looking glass to one seemingly routine night in the life of an Italian gas mask designer, played by Michel Piccoli.

22836: A band of satanist hippies roll into a town and begin terrorizing the local folk. They rape a local girl and her grandpa goes after them. He fails and is given LSD.

87259: It tells the story of a Korean boy born and raised in Japan (Kubozuka) and his love story with a Japanese girl (Shibasaki). The central theme of the movie is the integration problems of a Zainichi Koreans in Japanese society.

102383: New video from Richard Kern, a celebration of West Coast punk/skate culture by OFF!, which features ex-Black Flag singer Keith Morris.

20903: In June of 1791, a group of passengers in a stagecoach find themselves caught up in the events of the French Revolution, when they find themselves in the city of Varennes when revolutionists arrest the fleeing King Louis.

101188: A police investigation into a series of seemingly supernatural murders reveals a dark conspiracy in this stylized period mystery from director Law Chi-Leung. China: the warlord era. A young girl accused of stealing bullets from an arsenal pays the ultimate price at the hands of a crime boss.

106245: (…) To go to the other side, she builds a night vision, from those whom make the dead alive. A vision that has the makings of a dream, which makes the invisible visible: Orpheus falls asleep and allows the cinema to be.
What makes me take the train

22952: A young woman and a shepherd, both from different worlds, encounter each other and spend a day criss-crossing the Causse’s high plains looking for some of the shephard’s animals that have wandered off. While they walk, they talk about life, work and love.

21725: A two-minute rumination on the once volatile situation during the period of the Bosnian War, presented in the form of a photo-montage with accompanying text.

36132: The Alligator People is bizarre late 1950s sci-fi/horror tale.

76470: Rebellious teenager Dorian and his serious new friend, Grace, go into business selling pot in this engaging indie drama. Dorian wants financial independence, and Grace needs funds for medical school after her mother screws up her finances.

55468: As optically challenged millionaire Mr. Magoo bumbles through life desperately in need of spectacles, he finds himself at a museum just as jewel thief Luanne LeSeur is attempting to steal the Star of Kuristan, a priceless ruby.

130867: Some resemblances are disturbing. That between a guillotined viscount, an army chaplain, a Parisian tramp, and the concierge of the building where the lives of nearly all these characters intersect. And yet in the midst of all the chaos, there is the chance to hope for a better tomorrow.

3485: USA sports Superstar LeBron James’ extraordinary rise to fame and his personal history. As well as gripping basketball action, this remarkable true-life coming of age story is about the rare and fierce friendship of five players in the face of unprecedented fame.

29670: Takes place on a fair summer night and follows a group of young teenagers on their way from innocence to adulthood. Grand Jury Prize at the 2010 Prague Short Film Festival.

108287: An eighteen year old boy gets a summer job in a nursing home and develops a deep emotional attachment to an old man. Discovering that the old man, along with the other patients, is being over-medicated to make him easier to manage, the boy helps him escape.

91614: A visual interpretation of Honegger’s orchestral piece, inspired by the physical excitement and drama of an express train as it leaves the station and rushes through the countryside.

34163: FOR COLORED GIRLS weaves together the stories of nine different women as they move into and out of one another’s existences; some are well known to one another, others are as yet strangers.

115594: As the Allies march toward Paris, Hitler gives orders that nothing should be left of the city’s former glory. Assigned to carry out this act is General Dietrich von Choltitz. However, Swedish Consul Raoul Nordling steals into German headquarters and tries to persuade Choltitz to abandon his plan.

76514: Hoping to make some quick cash, four ordinary citizens volunteer for a run-of-the-mill paid research study only to discover that it’s actually a nightmarish government experiment that threatens their sanity — and their lives.

5476: Fred is living in the Paris Metro system. He is blackmailing Helena, whose safe he has robbed. Fred has various ‘friends’ all living in this sureal setting. The Roller is a rollerskating bag snatcher and Big Bill is a ‘strongman’.

34007: Members of a dysfunctional, white, upper class family in Peru grapple with their own prejudices and inter-personal issues when the patriarch brings home his new, lower class girlfriend who also happens to be his former secretary.

2417: In New York’s 1880’s newspaper district a dedicated journalist manages to set up his own paper.

52911: Nearly 1,000 years ago, a malevolent leprechaun left a bloody trail in his wake when he ripped through the countryside in search of his stolen pot of gold. Now, he’s back in the big city, using his deadly charms to find the girl of his nightmares.

4580: Set across England, the United States, and Vietnam, this vibrant musical uses the songs of The Beatles to shape its romantic tale of an upper-class American girl who falls for a young artist during the 1960s.

88209: Simulation of an alternating eyelid with a one-eye camera.

50458: Tony is trying to keep his failing Miami hotel afloat while raising his 12-year-old son (Eddie Hodges). As a last resort, he’s forced to ask his harried brother, Mario, for help, but he’ll only bail Tony out if he marries a sensible woman.

3729: One-year journey through the land of incessant progress, researching those sources which have given rise twenty years later to the essential question of survival.

2573: A series of overlapping stories about four suburban families dealing with different maladies.

97853: The crew of the space battleship Yamato set out on a journey to the planet Iscandar to acquire a device that can heal the ravaged Earth.

31153: In his directorial debut, two-time Academy Award-winner Robert De Niro stars as Lorenzo Anello, a hard-working bus driver who must stand up to the local mob if he is to keep his son from falling into a life of crime.

1778: Winner of two Oscars, this quirky road flick finds a family of six hauling up in a VW camper van in order to fulfill their seven-year-old daughter’s desire to enter a child beauty pageant.

33822: Rist’s well-developed technique of mixing the personal, the pop and the mass cultural are distilled in this short work. Against a backdrop of tranquil Swiss alpine scenes, a small window presents a graphic record of human birth.
When My Mother's Brother Was Born It Smelled Like Wild Pear Blossom in Front of the Brown-burnt Sill

152997: Veniamin, a teenager in the midst of a mystical crisis, has his mother, schoolmates and entire high school turned upside down by his questions.

37598: A poor family on holiday in the Algarve become millionaires overnight when their son discovers a stash of drugs buried on the beach. Their story mixes with various other tales of wealth and poverty in contemporary Portugal.

55298: After settling in the tiny Australian town of Walkabout Creek with his significant other and his young son, Mick “Crocodile” Dundee is thrown for a loop when a prestigious Los Angeles newspaper offers his honey a job.

29080: The american Bill Tate joins the gang of bandits led by “El Chuncho”, who steals and sells arms to mexican revolution leader General Elias. Chuncho innocently forms a friendship with the young gringo, but soon starts suspecting the kid might be hiding his true intentions.

32604: Zhao is an aging bachelor who hasn’t been lucky in love. Thinking he has finally met the woman of his dreams, Zhao leads her to believe he is wealthy and agrees to a wedding far beyond his means. Zhao’s best friend Li hatches the idea to raise the money by refurbishing an abandoned bus.

89817: The belly has always been the root of all evil. If you focus on this heavily used and abused body part for the length of a whole film a whole cosmos of meaning opens up. The camera work is dazzling and the many twists, surprises and open endings.

10446: After survivng his own execution, Tenshu choses to be subjected to the bizarre experiments of the prison officials.

1340: “Dear Diary, there is something I like to do more than anything else…” These lines open the author’s diary, the confidant of the most hidden thoughts. A diary in images, free and light as only personal thoughts can be.

30731: In order to cure her ailments, a sickly girl in 16th century Portugal collects poppies to place on her pillow. Unfortunately, the poppies begin giving her strange and disturbing hallucinations and visions of the horrors to come for her nation.

33946: Deborah Chow’s dark drama centers on the burgeoning relationship between an unlikely pair (Isabelle Blais, Zach Braff).

31917: Heinrich Harrer is an Austrian national and a Nazi sympathizer, who leaves Austria in 1939 to climb the Himalayas. Through a series of circumstances, he and a fellow climber become the only two foreigners in the Tibetan holy city of Lhasa. There Heinrich’s life changes forever…

10522: A woman who lost her husband in a random act of violence and a heroin addict who was a lifelong friend of the dearly departed discover that the beloved husband and friend’s unfortunate passing is actually a blessing in disguise.
Things We Lost in the Fire

32760: An animated film drawn entirely in pastels. Various fantastical plant-like things “grow” from the ground, eventually launching five spheres.

37880: On holiday at a camp-site, Camille finds herself bored as she hangs around waiting for Fred, her boyfriend, who works at the bar. She ends up meeting Blaise, a sailing instructor whose personality is similar to hers despite the age difference.

3311: The Jeffersons are the ideal picture-perfect all-American family of the McCarthy era, except that “son John” is gay, an atheist, and a liberal. The parents obviously suspect he’s a Communist spy.

28012: On a Tuesday night, five couples have separate sexual adventures. Each couple answers the basic questions: can sex be anonymous, are we bored, is our marriage really finished, does anyone tell the truth, and how do we make someone happy?

88885: Havetta’s debut inspired by naive painting, French impressionism, and silent slapstick. It also combines motives from traditions of the people of Western Slovakia.

29248: Nicodemus sneaks out of church and soon finds himself in hell. There, he learns the error of his ways, and when he wakes up again in the living world, he makes haste to the church.

4370: Although he was born in America, Roshan decides to take his ill grandmother back home to India. Arriving in Chandni Chowk, the ancient walled city of Delhi, Roshan finds himself on an unexpected inner journey as he learns about himself and his roots.

49519: Hong Kong funnyman Stephen Chow plays real-life legendary figure So-Hat-Yi, the spoiled son of a millionaire who finds his dream girl and soul mate but must win a “Kung Fu Scholar” tournament to win her hand.

37750: In the early years of his reign, young King Louis XIV uses his power and influence to advance the cause of the arts, patronizing composer Jean-Baptiste Lully and playwright Molière.

92027: In a war-torn, futuristic mining planet, a soilder leads a small group in the fight against man-made killing machines.

48743: Six high school buddies accidentally kill a drug pusher and dump his body in toxic waters. When the pusher returns as a zombie and goes on a killing spree, their only option is to dump the body of one of their own recently dead, and have him return as a “good” zombie to face off with the “bad” one.

130147: At 25, Berthe dreams of making a living from her painting, to never marry, and to always stay with her sister Edma. Her parents do not see things from the same angle and are already shaping her a higher destiny.

35665: German silent following the life of Nina Petrovna, a high-class woman who falls in love with a lowly soldier.
The Wonderful Lies of Nina Petrovna

2383: Ryu is a fragile looking loner who lives a double life: she works in a fish factory and ocassionally as a hired assassin. A sound engineer, obsessed by the sounds of the city and fascinated by Ryu, is the mute witness to a love-story that begins between Ryu and a man she is hired to kill.
Map of the Sounds of Tokyo

90112: This past May, Neil Young brought his solo tour to Toronto’s Massey Hall, an iconic venue in the city of his birth.

129792: Three young conspiracy theorists attempt to uncover the mysteries of Area 51, the government’s secret location rumored to have hosted encounters with alien beings. What they find at this hidden facility exposes unimaginable secrets.

1188: Ayse, the daughter of a Greek family evacuated in 1916, has kept silent about her true identity, but secretly considers Greece her homeland. When she sets foot in Greece for the first time, both she and the viewer are forced to reconsider what constitutes a homeland, and what makes one a foreigner.

21279: Lala, a teenager from the most exclusive suburban neighbourhood in Buenos Aires is in love with the Guayi, the 20-year-old Payaguayan maid working at her place. They dream of living together in Paraguay, at the shores of lake Ypoá.

43905: Yuichiro (Ryo Kase) is a college student whose sister went missing 15 years ago. That traumatic event hangs over him like a pall as he wanders Japan’s S&M clubs. But his younger brother claims to be able to sense their sister with his “antenna”.

8287: Cinecitta, the huge movie studio outside Rome, is 50 years old and Fellini is interviewed by Japanese television.

24081: The first feature of Kumar Shahani, it’s based on a short story by Hindi writer Nirmal Varma. It makes female sexuality and the very textures of living the focus of a conflict between oppresive feudal norms and a changing industrialised landscape.

105476: Martha Rosler takes us through an A-Z of the kitchen in this parodic feminist art film.

42997: Gena the Crocodile works as a crocodile in an urban zoo. Every evening he returns home to his lonely flat. Gena gets very tired of playing chess against himself and decides to find himself some friends. Animals and people respond to his advertisements that he posts throughout the city.

25177: The filming of a chronicle of Jesus’ death in Israel deeply affects three people–an egotistical director who cast himself as Christ, the actress playing Mary Magdalene who cannot bring herself to leave Bethlehem and a TV journalists whose spiritual doubts start to consume him.

100446: The Man of Steel finds himself outshone by a new team of ruthless superheroes who hold his idealism in contempt.

46851: An ex-con who’s taken part in the robbery of a racetrack is caught and sent back to prison, but he won’t tell his fellow gang members where he’s stashed the loot. The gang kidnaps his girlfriend and has him tortured in prison in an effort to find out where the money is.

18477: On a tiny snow-covered isle in the White Sea, a religious man strives to atone for the sin he committed 30 years earlier under Nazi duress.

41684: Abram returns to his small village and although his repairing skills are needed, people’s suspicion about his sexual preferences make his life hard.

44964: Roy Arnie has a dream. One day he will run his own circus and conquer the world. Today, he is a stable-hand working in the Circus Stromowski, a miserable Russian big top, run by a circus director, Igor Stromowski, and full of tired animals, which will only perform under the influence of narcotics.

65551: Nothing gets past the razor-sharp wit of George Carlin, who serves up his droll take on everything from embarrassing underwear incidents to those who need to share their bathroom adventures and, of course, more ludicrous uses of the English language.

25013: An eccentric adaptation of the Virginia Woolf story Orlando.

47713: A retelling of the Greek myth of Phaedra. In modern Greece, Alexis’s father, an extremely wealthy shipping magnate, marries the younger, fiery Phaedra. When Alexis meets his stepmother, sparks fly and the two begin an affair. What will the Fates bring this family?

39926: Set in an impoverished section of Calcutta, story of a dispirited American doctor, a British woman who runs a clinic for the poor and an Indian couple whose lives come together as they face the ravages of the city.

45742: A close-up survey of the everyday choreography our hands are involved in. Evidence of the ‘handsteps’ are re-traced and inadvertently repeated. By isolating acts from their greater purpose and environment, it attempts to construct a more abstract representation of their meaning.

46935: The girls of St. Trinians are on the hunt for buried treasure after discovering headmistress Miss Fritton is related to a famous pirate.
St Trinian's 2: The Legend of Fritton's Gold

44518: A greedy South American based arms dealer sets up a deal to offload a consignment of weapons onto dictator, General Cordosa.

19749: A man visits his old friend’s hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.

91267: A military group of men is locked up in a bunker in an unknown future. All those soldiers are waiting for an eventual enemy. But the discovery of a certain project will cause several catastrophies and will make those men kill each other…
The Bunker of the Last Gunshots

29203: A documentary above the making of “Fellini-Satyricon” and “Il Viaggio di G. Mastorna”, also containing a few fantasy sequences shot on purpose.

28059: Chris Gardner is an intelligent, energetic guy who can’t catch a break. His wife leaves him, he loses his apartment, and with his 5-year-old son in tow joins the ranks of the homeless, if not the hopeless. Against all odds, he pushes towards success.

69741: Odd-mannered English comedian Rowan Atkinson — a man known for creating colorful characters such as Edmund Blackadder and Mr. Bean — entertains a live audience in Boston in this 1991 stand-up performance that showcases his love of the absurd.
Rowan Atkinson: Not Just a Pretty Face

34510: Filmmaker and film activist Pip Chodorov offers this affectionate overview of some of the leading figures of 20th century experimental film.
Free Radicals: A History of Experimental Film

36541: An insurance salesman, caught in a caper involving a rare musical instrument, sets off a series of dramatic consequences.

54241: Take a big whiff… Mickey Rourke is Wheeler, a manipulative millionaire who operates out of Rio de Janeiro and likes his sex raw and erotic. Before you can order up a daiquiri, he initiates a steamy affair with a young American lawyer named Emily.

49552: After a plane crashes in the African jungle, a baby named George is rescued and raised by a protective primate. Years later, a wealthy woman on safari ditches her snooty fiancé in the jungle — and finds love unexpectedly with a grown-up George.

3192: Susan is laying in the hospital with a bullet near her heart. Marian has told the police that she shot Susan in a rage as Susan was giving up her singing. Marian and Luke found Susan when she was a failure.

108790: OutKast’s André Benjamin stars as Jimi Hendrix in this biopic of the rock legend.

14667: An idealistic young lawyer and his cynical partner take on a powerful law firm representing a corrupt insurance company.

34808: A painful yet comical journey of a soldier (Jackie Chan) who kidnaps a general (Wang Leehom) from an opposing state in the hopes of reward.

15791: An “underground” cartoonist contends with life in the inner city, where various unsavory characters serve as inspiration for his artwork.

36789: During a Caribbean holiday, a British civil servant finds herself falling in love with a Russian agent.

33415: As publicity for the exhibit Miró L’altre, organized by the Colegio de Arquitectos de Catalunya in 1969, the Board commissioned Pere Portabella to film Miró painting the “poster” for the exhibit on the ground floor windows of the building.

409: Eerie horror flick about a pair of sisters who return to their family home after spending time in a mental institution, forcing them to deal with past traumas, a neglectful father, a cruel stepmother, and an interfering ghost.

2064: Filmmakers Ryan Fleck and Anna Boden (Half Nelson) weave this introspective sports drama concerning a talented Dominican baseball player who longs to break into the American big league and earn the money needed to support his impoverished family.

57282: This drama is based on the true story of North Korea’s Higher Intelligence Department (HID), whose 31 members were trained to infiltrate South Korea with the mission of attacking the presidential palace and assassinating President Park Chung-hee.

96362: An octopus slithers over objects on land – a doll, a skull – then oozes along the shore into the sea. It secretes its ink. The camera follows it along rocks into deeper water, watching closely as it breathes.

129809: Darkness has crept in. The hours pass quietly. A window ajar. A shadow observes the moonlight from the window.

31520: A young couple who are into kinky “mind games” get more than they bargained for when a mysterious woman comes into their lives.

911: Four city slickers canoe down an uncharted section of the Cahulawassee river before a dam project is to takeover the region. Initially mesmerised by the wonders of nature the group soon become fully aware of what it really means to survive outside the safety net of civilization.

96206: Based on a novel by Yasuko Harada. Story of a young handicapped girl and her relationship with a married architect and his wife.

108558: Costa da Morte is a region in the northwest of Galicia (Spain), which was considered to be the end of the world during the Roman period. Its dramatic name comes from the numerous shipwrecks that took place over the course of history in this area comprised of rocks, mist and storms.

114011: When a tragedy shatters her plans for domestic bliss, a seemingly typical Southern newlywed gradually transforms into a spiritual seeker, quietly threatening the closest relationships around her.

33571: Small-farmer Pasi shoots four policemen who have come to arrest him for raged drunkenness. Rest of the movie is a long flashback examining the events that finally leads to the tragic shooting. As time goes by, Pasi sinks gradually deeper and deeper into the poverty, gets into trouble with both polic

12944: Tom Sawyer, Becky Thatcher, and Huck Finn stow away with Mark Twain on an incredible journey to meet with Halley’s Comet – a journey that takes them through a variety of Twain’s stories and characters.

81411: Desperate to save their marriage, one couple convinces three other couples to go in on a group rate price for an island retreat designed for troubled unions. But the “mandatory therapy” brews up nothing but trouble for everyone.

39809: The story of a father’s tireless love for his autistic son. A terminally ill father’s attempt to teach his autistic son the necessary life skills to survive on his own before he passes away.

102820: A young woman travels to Texas to collect an inheritance; little does she know that an encounter with a chainsaw-wielding killer is part of the reward.

22395: A rich woman trapped in her private elevator after a power outage must watch as her house is robbed by a group of young thugs who then proceed to terrorize her as she tries to find a way out of her predicament.

46502: After two years in a Czarist British agent posing as a Russian Commissar rescues a Russian countess from her Bolshevik captors.

24202: Kidlat Tahimik’s best work, about the exploitation of a small town by German investors.

44553: Santa’s little helpers must hurry to finish the toys before Christmas Day.

27009: If A Family Finds Entertainment can be reduced to a thumbnail description, this might be it: Trecartin stars as Skippy, a clownish but terrifyingly psychopathic boy who has locked himself in the upstairs bathroom of his family home during a wild party.

99256: In semi-obscurity, we hear a few chords on the guitar, a man whispering into a microphone then into a recording device on the Mekong river bank, that will relay his voice…

21232: When a young man is confronted with his mortality, he takes a cross-country road trip on a vintage motorcycle.

86968: A 60-year-old Palestinian and his son arrive at an archaeological site of an ancient Jewish settlement and buy tickets to enter. This is their only way to return to their abandoned home village, which they have not visited for 25 years.

47888: A young woman is killed by a bunch of thugs.  She rises from her grave as a ghost zombie in order to revenge her death.

23263: Drama about an old man who lives alone on a deserted island which the Soviet fighter planes use for nighttime target practicing.

9096: In 1975, a young policewoman, just out of the Academy, is teamed with an experienced vice officer to work undercover to purge a small Texas city of its flourishing drug trade. In the course of their work, the two officers become personally involved with narcotics and with each other.

84421: Well aware of his own blessings, up-and-coming Wall Street star Tommy Fielding decides to mentor one of his co-workers, Daniel. But his new protégé may prove too apt a pupil in this romantic comedy penned and helmed by Julio DePietro.

18790: This portrait of female volunteer workers at an optics plant during World War II, shot on location at the Nippon Kogaku factory, was created with a patriotic agenda. Yet it anticipates the aesthetics of Japanese cinema’s postwar social realism.

106636: A traveler puts up at an inn. He hangs his overcoat and hat upon a peg in his room, but he finds, instantly, that his clothes are on his back again. He takes off his coat a second time, but it instantly returns. He becomes enraged.

21356: The Aso, a family of four, live in the old town of Nara. On the day of the Jizo Festival in the dizzying heat of midsummer, Kei, one of the Aso’s twin boys suddenly disappears, as if he had been spirited away…

23307: A wife tries to leave her village to get away from her abusive husband.

124808: A scandalous story involving Governor Carmelo Vargas in serious crimes and illicit business.

38583: Life changes dramatically for Czech housemaid Cinderella when the house driver gives her three magical hazel nuts.

107810: Inspired by Korean culture and entertainment that fluxed around Asia, the film tells a love story of a guy and a girl who destined to meet in Seoul during their private trip to Korea.

126425: Nahid, a young divorcee, lives alone with her 10 year old son in a small city on the Caspian Sea. According to Iranian tradition, custody reverts to the father but the latter agreed to transfer her to his ex-wife, provided she does not remarry…

25290: The assassination of the would be ruler of Rome at the hands of Brutus and company has tragic consequences for the idealist and the republic.

104446: Oceana, West Virginia—known as “Oxyana” after its residents’ epidemic abuse of OxyContin—is a tragically real example of the insidious spread of drug dependency throughout the country…

23126: In this delicate, introspective drama, laced with fantasy elements, Tuesday Weld stars as a fragile young woman in New York, unable to reconcile her ambiguous past with her unmoored present.

21177: A psychiatrist injects LSD in four volunteers to study the effects of the toxic under the influence of the image of Coffin Joe. The character appears differently in the psychedelics delusions of each one, mixing sex, perversion and sadism.

46997: A couple of comical, out-of-work archaeologists (Dick Foran and Wallace Ford) in Egypt discover evidence of the burial place of the ancient Egyptian princess Ananka.

23042: Veronique [Marie Gillain], living with her divorced mother, is going on holiday to Mauritius with her father [Gerard Depardieu]. To impress a local boy, Benjamin [Patrick Mille], she manages to complicate the situation by making up a stories about her father.

20249: A corpse enacts a final erratic ballet in this exquisite experimental dance film.

43713: A waxwork museum comes to town, and a mysterious man invites some teens to come to a special showing at midnight. Once inside, while viewing different exhibits, the scenes come alive and the viewer is sucked into the story being portrayed.

21013: Carsten leads a comfortable, middle class, if mundane, life as a middle-aged secondary school teacher until he starts an affair with a much younger former student and political activist.

27228: Two mismatched New York City detectives seize an opportunity to step up like the city’s top cops whom they idolize — only things don’t quite go as planned.

85692: After years of living under his sisters’ watchful eyes, longtime bachelor Harry Quincey meets a charming woman at work. But his siblings aren’t so sure they want their brother to be happy, and one makes it clear she’s against it.
The Strange Affair of Uncle Harry

41892: A fatally shot female gang-leader recounts her sordid life of crime to a police officer just before she dies…

8: Christine’s life is changes when she discovers a child’s body killed in a hit-and-run accident.  The longer the search for the killer goes on, the more the facts are obscured. In a village where everyone’s lives are linked, no one is truly innocent and everyone has blood on their hands.

19523: Just as a media mogul unveils his new global news service, a British warship is attacked in Chinese territory. Agent James Bond teams with a beautiful Chinese spy to discover the truth before war breaks out.

26072: Robert Hansen is a cop in Copenhagen who makes a mistake, is remanded for therapy, then assigned to a mysterious small town in South Jutland, where cows and problems disappear into the mud.

24023: Andrzej Żuławski’s adaptation of Manuela Gretkowska’s provocative and hugely successful novel reaches new extremes in the depiction of brutality, sex, and passion as it tells the story of a young(ish) anthropologist driven by the mystery surrounding the death of a recently discovered shaman.

8341: After the critical lambasting of his masterpiece Earth, Dovzhenko returned with a more popular iteration of its main motifs. Much like Earth, Ivan concerns itself with the natural rhythms of country life, disrupted by the beat of looming industrialisation.

25279: The devil loses his left horn, which is found by an elderly man in Britain who uses it as a hearing trumpet. Soon the man experiences a series of aural and visual hallucinations.

38872: A mouse tells the story of how he guided Benjamin Franklin to success and prominence.

45830: The traditional story of the little chicken who believes that the sky is falling … but with a decidedly different ending.

81630: John Wayne is Wil Andersen, an aging rancher who can’t find local cowboys to run his cattle drive. His solution: Hire schoolboys, who will be forced to become men fast when they’re attacked by a cattle-rustling gang.

79316: In his final filmed performance and 14th HBO special, counterculture comic George Carlin urges Americans to just say no to BS, serving up sharp-witted takes on society’s ridiculous obsessions, the self-esteem movement fallout and spoiled kids.
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya

24147: Based on real life events, Assassination is set in 1974 and centers on a businessman who decides to take extreme measures to achieve his American dream.

2321: Jean Renoir’s last film presents four witty sketches – four variations on a theme, “C’est la revolution” – with an entr’acte performance by Jeanne Moreau as a kind of deadpan Nana. Renoir himself acts as master of ceremonies, raconteur, and interpreter.
The Little Theatre of Jean Renoir

68496: Three high school freshmen devise a novel plan for dealing with the treacherous school bully: They hire a bodyguard. Salvation comes in the form of Drillbit Taylor, a beach bum ex-soldier who teaches the boys some handy life lessons.

108779: Saoirse Ronan (Hanna) stars in this adaptation of Meg Rosoff’s award-winning near-future novel about an American teenager sent to live with her family in Britain on the eve of the Third World War, directed by Kevin McDonald (The Last King of Scotland).

31701: A relaxing vacation becomes an impromptu family reunion when a family of three takes a sun soaked trip to their summer cottage, only to find the entire extended family unexpectedly showing up on their doorstep.

30843: A man who is on a pilgrimage spends the night with a woman. After they share a moment of passion, he runs away and she chases him.

96143: Follows disillusioned young family man John as a mysterious stranger, Richie takes him on a murder-fueled ride that transforms the weak-willed John into a desperate hero willing to go to any length to protect his family.

130081: Undercover cop Chan Chi-kit becomes a junkie in order to catch Mr Hung, the mastermind behind a crime syndicate.

97319: The film is about the coal mafia in Dhanbad, Jharkhand.  It is set across three generations and six decades.

628: The unlikely trio of a skilled thief, a notorious prison escapee and a booze-addled ex-cop plot a sting. With a dogged inspector on their tale, they face impossible odds.

31665: A documentary about George A. Romero’s films, with a behind scenes look at Dawn of the Dead.

89601: The best way to escape from your pursuers without leaving any traces behind you is to walk backwards over your own footprints. This is what French artist and author François Augiéras believed as he painted every inch of the walls of a military bunker in the desert…

6383: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

13427: After his girl leaves him for someone else, Herbert gets really depressed and starts searching for a job. He finally finds one in a big house which is inhabited by many, many women. Can he live in the same home with all these females?

36604: Old Thorgeir must leave his home far off in the Icelandic countryside and move into a home for senior citizens in Reykjavik. There he meets an old friend from his childhood, Stella. Thorgeir soon becomes unhappy living there and together with Stella he steals a jeep.

30793: Production drops at Porky’s wartime Flockheed Eggcraft Factory when the hens leave their posts to hear Frankie, a crooning rooster, sing.

14446: Two brothers and a friend find $4 million in the cockpit of a downed plane. The pilot is dead. No one is looking for the money. To keep it, all they have to do is wait.

37822: This episodic tale explores the expectations for life, love, and happiness among three average Chinese thirty-somethings—characters who exist mostly on only emptiness and unfulfilled wishes.

29146: A research scientist conducting experiments on a new anaesthetic finds herself being blackmailed by a women she accidentally knocked down with her car; the woman wasn’t hurt, but a scheming attorney has convinced her she can get a lot of money for the “accident.”

33598: In 1997, rap superstars Tupac Shakur and Christopher Wallace (aka Biggie Smalls) were gunned down in separate incidents, the apparent victims of hip hop’s infamous east-west rivalry. Documentarian Nick Broomfield delves into the shootings.

34655: A semi-paralyzed radio reporter is sent out to investigate a story that leads him into an odd subculture and on a journey of disturbing self-realization.

1286: Painlevé was a film director, critic, theorist, and animator, yet his interests and studies also extended to mathematics, medicine, and zoology. All these strands came together in a groundbreaking, decades-spanning artistic career.  This anthology features twenty-three of Painlevé’s shorts.
Science Is Fiction: 23 Films by Jean Painlevé

150518: With the ability to travel in time, a lonely girl finds love and comfort by connecting with her past self. Eventually faced with rejection she struggles with her identity and gender, and as time folds onto itself only one of them can remain.

93017: Annabelle (Whitford) Moore performs one of her popular dance routines. She uses her dance steps and her long, flowing skirts to create a variety of visual patterns.

15778: Sybylla Melvyn is an independent young woman who soon after arriving to live with her Grandmother Bossier and aunt Helen announces that she will never marry and plans on having a career instead.

33880: Faith (Marisa Tomei) believes that two soul-mates can be united if they find each other. From the Ouija board, she has found the name of her missing half…

95180: When Malcolm and Sofia’s latest graffiti masterpiece is buffed by a rival gang, these two determined Bronx teens must hustle, steal, and scheme to get spectacular revenge and become the biggest writers in the City.

48955: When uptight upperclassman Alfred (Freddy Prinze) and free-spirited undergraduate Imogen (Julia Stiles) meet, they prove opposites attract. The twist? The story is narrated from both points of view.

5340: After Paul D. finds his old slave friend Sethe in Ohio and moves in with her and her daughter Denver, a strange girl comes along by the name of “Beloved”. Sethe and Denver take her in and then strange things start to happen…

17729: Upbeat, lets-put-on-a-show, musical about the wonders of rap music tells the story of Kenny, a young hip-hop artist living in the rough slums of the Bronx with his younger brother Lee and their mother Cora.

37946: Max accepts a wager that he cannot remain in a haunted castle for one hour without crying for help. As soon as he arrives he encounters strange and nightmarish visions, but when he is on the verge of winning the bet, a phone-call brings startling news.

100703: A story about a man’s protest against the domination of numbers.

99390: Through paintings that operate on similar principles to those of nested Russian dolls, we follow the spiralling train of thought of a peregrine, a solitary stroller.

44739: In this “pink musical,” Asuka is strolling near a lake one day, when she spots a large Kappa, a supposedly mythical beast that has the body of a man, the shell of a turtle, and the face of a bird. Asuka takes the Kappa home, and falls into a strange but passionate affair with the sea beast.

26039: An Ukrainian woman named Irena calculatedly insinuates herself into the lives of a young, affluent Italian family.

101559: Luke is an up-and-coming DJ from an affluent New York family with a Lithuanian father and an African-American mother…

103974: A portrait of influential American film critic Jonathan Rosenbaum.

25232: A Vegas show dog gets ditched in the sticks and ends up working on a farm.

47532: The Making of 'Scenes from the Suburbs'

87688: A musical parable of crowded communal living.

24068: Vampires are invading a small New England town. It’s up to a novelist and a young horror fan to save it.

9150: A ballet rendition of Bram Stoker’s gothic novel, presented in a style reminiscent of the silent expressionistic cinema of the early 20th Century.
Dracula: Pages from a Virgin's Diary

38839: Odds & Ends is a sly comment on the collage film and Beat culture.

38445: Straub examines the process by which events enter our cultural mainstream, and the process by which their use as part of a communications system is transformed into Culture. Corneille’s play of political intrigue in Late Empire Rome is used as a base.
Eyes Do Not Want to Close at All Times, or, Perhaps One Day Rome Will Allow Herself to Choose in Her Turn

122859: When the old-old-old-fashioned vampire Vlad arrives at the hotel for an impromptu family get-together, Hotel Transylvania is in for a collision of supernatural old-school and modern day cool.

121582: For 12-year-old Alexander Cooper, everyday is a bad day. And his family thinks he’s being silly because they never have a bad day. So on the eve of his birthday, he wishes that his whole family can have a bad day too.
Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day

40437: Beth Gibbons is seen floating in air. The people were shot in a tank of water and then digitally inserted into an alleyway of a street scene.

18986: Three of the most popular girls at Reagan High accidentally kill the prom queen with a jaw-breaker when a kidnapping goes horribly wrong.

101791: After discovering what a “coming of age” story is, a young adolescent becomes caught up in the formula of the genre, and begins to live and plan out her life accordingly, much to the dismay of her mother.

40553: The necrorealist science fiction plot involves a team of scientists attempting to cross a human being with a tree, and a special unit dispatched to hunt down the zombie-like mutants created in a previous, failed experiment

22253: Jean Vigo’s second film is partly a homage to French swimming champion Jean Taris but mainly as an experiment into the possibilities of underwater film photography.

85909: Young mother Birdee Pruitt returns to her Texas hometown after learning (on national television) that her husband has been unfaithful. Humiliated, Birdee tries to build a new life for herself and her lonely daughter.

21058: Young Augusten Burroughs absorbs experiences that could make for a shocking memoir: the son of an alcoholic father and an unstable mother, he’s handed off to his mother’s therapist, Dr. Finch, and spends his adolescent years as a member of Finch’s bizarre extended family.

43758: A story set in 19th century China and centered on the lifelong friendship between two girls who develop their own secret code as a way to contend with the rigid cultural norms imposed on women.
Snow Flower and the Secret Fan

20202: An opportunistic landowner endeavours to survive the Mexican Revolution by playing both sides of the fence, changing sides as circumstances dictate, in this classic work from director Fernando de Fuentes, a pre-eminent figure of the early Mexican cinema.

42502: A Chicago man’s hope for a peaceful family vacation in the woods is shattered when the annoying in-laws drop in.

98266: Bestselling novelist Mike Noonan receives ghostly visitations, escalating nightmares and the realization that his late wife still has something to tell him.

92362: The fluid grace of an eight-arm embrace, the silken glance of an inscrutably bulbous eye … Among the most magical films ever made, this is Painlevé’s affectionate portrait of another anomalous sea-creature. The startling soundtrack is by electronic music pioneer, Pierre Henry.
The Love Life of the Octopus

48406: Ethan Mascarenhas, formerly the world’s greatest magician, has been quadriplegic since a performance went wrong 14 years before.  His internal organs are failing, and to avoid permanent hospitalization and machine life-support, Ethan petitions a court to be legally allowed to die.

31582: Young Debbie Benson has a dream – to join the “Texas Cowgirl” cheerleaders! When her parents disapprove, she and her girlfriends hatch a plan to help Debbie raise money to go to the Texas auditions.

28357: A highly disciplined Russian detective and a fearless, but undisciplined Chicago cop are one mismatched team hot on the trail of Russia’s deadliest drug smuggler throughout the mean streets of Chicago.

16944: This was Jerry Lewis’ answer to the classic Cinderella story. When his father dies, poor Fella is left at the mercy of his snobbish stepmother and her two no-good sons.

37571: Recently widowed Sandra Demarest arrives at the isolated home of her late husband for his wake, but his uncle will not allow her to view the corpse.

29069: Seven prisoners are escorted to a prison by a soldier and his daughter. All the prisoners are chained to one-another. In a fight with some bandits they lose their wagon and horses and a long journey through high, snowy mountains awaits them.

4151: A musical story of amorous escapades in Paris of struggling young American painter, played by Gene Kelly.

14915: The small kingdom of Marshovia has a little problem. The main tax-payer, the wealthy widow Sonia (who pays 52 0f the taxes) has left for Paris So Count Danilo is sent to Paris, to stop her from getting married by a stranger, so that the danger of removing the money is banned.

28233: When young Danny Madigan receives a magic ticket to the new Jack Slater film, Danny is transported into Slater’s world. But one of Slater’s enemies, Benedict the hitman, gets hold of the ticket and ends up in the real world. It is up to Slater and Danny to stop him.

90257: Born and raised near Vienna, Michael Haneke grew up as the son of actors and stems from a bourgeois and privileged background. For this intriguing profile Haneke opens – for the first time ever – his universe.

12882: Fourteen-year-old Christiane lives with her mother and little sister in a small apartment in a dull neighbourhood in the outskirts of West Berlin. She’s bored and lacks things to do and is sick and tired of living there.

32541: A young man returns to his home city of Pittsburgh and moves in with an older woman whom he begins to rely on for emotional and financial support.

707: Director Luc Moullet plays a movie director who is having a hard time making ends meet and is also having a hard time satisfying his wife. In the film, they fight and talk, make up, talk and fight.

88574: A renowned author and debunker of hoaxes, Florence Cathcart is called to a provincial boarding school to explain away sightings of a phantom boy. What she discovers will prompt her to reconsider her deductive tactics — and send her mind spiraling back to a distant, forgotten past.

49494: Shy good girl Janey befriends cool rock chick Lynne on their first day of school. When Lynne convinces Janey to dismiss her overbearing father and sneak out to audition for her favorite TV dance show, Janey makes the cut.
Girls Just Want to Have Fun

663: While laboring to sell a gold-embossed version of the Good Book, Paul Brennan and his colleagues target the beleaguered masses—then face the demands of quotas and the frustrations of life on the road. A landmark American documentary.

13810: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

32425: The school janitor Mario (Massimo Troisi) and the teacher Saverio (Roberto Benigni) have a car failure and decide to spend the night at an inn. The next morning they awake in Tuscany in 1492.
Nothing Left to Do but Cry

30808: An amusingly bleak hearted tale of two weather lashed old spinsters. Lol and Edna Pearce live on a remote and austere strip of coast. Taking shelter in a beaten driftwood shack they scrape out a miserable existence from the sea.

32859: 14-year-old Arrietty and the rest of the Clock family live in peaceful anonymity as they make their own home from items “borrowed” from the house’s human inhabitants. However, life changes for the Clocks when a human boy discovers Arrietty.

1005: A quiet, epileptic taxidermist plans the perfect crime.  All he needs is the right opportunity.  An accident, perhaps…

30474: Daffy is an agent representing Sleepy LaGoof trying to sell him to talent scout Porky.

70136: After recent med school grad Ted lands an internship at a prestigious pathology unit in a Philadelphia hospital, he soon finds his new colleagues have some pathological tendencies themselves.

117114: A newlywed couple finds their lake-country honeymoon descend into chaos after Paul finds Bea wandering and disoriented in the middle of their first night.

3974: Inspired by the earthy eroticism of his muse Harriet Andersson, in the first of her many roles for him, Ingmar Bergman had a major international breakthrough with this ravaging, sensual tale of young love.

1559: Roong longs for the day when she can be in the arms of her Burmese lover, Min, an illegal immigrant suffering from a strange illness.  One afternoon, Min and Roong sneak off to have a picnic in the jungle…

31372: A FBI informant has kept his new identity secret for 15 years, now an old flame has recognised him and the bad guys are back for revenge.

92592: A gynecologist attempts to rid the world of sexual problems by separating sex on the one hand and reproduction, which he feels should be left to artificial wombs.

51423: After descending upon the Sunshine State to attend a ceremony honoring newly retired Commandant Lassard, Capt. Harris and a group of former academy misfits find themselves embroiled in massive crime ring involving stolen gems.

3508: A coward teams up with a hardened killer and two young girls, who have resorted to unorthodox methods of survival, during a zombie apocalypse. The quarrelsome foursome begin to wonder whether they should take their chances alone.

1925: ‘Horizontal Boundaries’ is a film that looks at certain aspects of the geography of California as the ground for cinematic disruption and restatement.

76981: An autistic 9-year-old boy cracks the U.S. government’s top-secret code when an unapproved test matrix gets published in a crossword magazine.

5987: Gie was a central yet unknown activist/writer who lived in Indonesia in the sixties. His life was a clash between the high drama of national political events and the small world of friendship and romance.

31216: On the day of their Father’s 70th birthday party, four siblings come to terms with the publication of a novel written by the youngest sibling, that exposes the family’s most intimate secrets.

13054: A rural maiden’s two suitors go off to war, leaving her pregnant.

88028: Hanna is the famous Korean pop singer. She suffers from having extremely poor self-esteem, as she has been ignored because of her appearance. At last, she makes the decision of a lifetime to have full-body plastic surgery.

3810: Sarraounia, Warrior Queen of the Aznas, leads her forces to a brief victory against the French colonists at the turn of the century.

37381: Rosalie loves to shop too much to let a little thing like no money stop her. When the local shopkeepers no longer take her bad checks or bad credit cards…

1841: Dave (Dennis Christopher) dreams of becoming a champion bicycle racer, and since he knows that the best racers in the world are Italian, he sets out to re-invent himself as an Italian, driving his working-class father crazy in the process…

2636: An Eskimo who has had little contact with white men goes to a trading post where he accidentally kills a missionary and finds himself being pursued by the police.

113746: Northern China, 1999. The grisly discovery of several corpses is made in a small town. A bloody incident during the attempt to capture the alleged murderer leaves two police officers dead and another badly injured…

16064: The movie’s plot is based on the true story of a group of young computer hackers from Hannover, Germany. In the late 1980s the orphaned Karl Koch invests his heritage in a flat and a home computer.

34226: A police inspector, suspecting an attorney of two child sex murders, has him held for a questioning session that goes on for hours.

1791: Felicie and Charles have a serious if whirlwind holiday romance. Due to a mix-up on addresses they lose contact, and five years later, with a daughter as a reminder of that long-ago summer, Felicie is left unable to commit to anything else wondering what might have been.

131460: A young boy living in a mysterious, isolated seaside clinic uncovers the sinister purposes of his keepers.

29451: A Bill Plympton short about a man dining alone at a restaurant.

93818: An investigative and powerfully emotional examination of the epidemic of rape of soldiers within the U.S. military, the institutions that cover up its existence and the profound personal and social consequences that arise from it.

113622: Rose Hathaway is a Dhampir, half human/vampire, guardians of the Moroi, peaceful, mortal vampires living discretely within our world. Her legacy is to protect the Moroi from bloodthirsty, immortal Vampires, the Strigoi. This is her story.

30284: A young man killed in Vietnam inexplicably returns home as a zombie.

4915: Two farmhands share a cottage full of mechanical devices for making life easy. They are rivals for the farmer’s daughter. Keaton, disguised as a scarecrow, causes troubles for his rival and the farmer. When Keaton stoops to tie his shoe, the girl accepts what she thinks is his kneeling proposal.

37149: Paul is happily married to Suzanna, living together in a quiet neighborhood. As Suzanna notices that their new neighbors are expressive dancers with revealing outfits, she demands Paul complain to them about their lack of morality. As Paul knocks on their door, he finds out that one is an old flame.

93464: Bilo and his friends made an agreement with Maho to go to Germany.

110429: Two parents fall in love over the course of a single day while playing hooky from their children’s college tour.

36313: Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) looks into two surprising deaths, one of which was Dr. Watson’s friend Julian (Edmund Breon).

2882: In Seoul, the paths of two men and one woman intersect and move apart from one another, centering around their love for cinema.

23929: The film visualizes the connections between memories, fantasies, expectations and the failures of an individual as he sleeps.  It re-invents the visionary aesthetics of the early days of cinema, in the digital age.
The Two Names of a Testimony

43204: Filmmaker Isaac Julien uses film clips and interviews to illustrate the history of the so-called “blaxploitation” genre.

21504: Favraux, an unscrupulous banker, receives a threatening note, signed by “Judex”, demanding that he pay back the people he has swindled. He refuses, and apparently dies after a midnight toast at his masked ball.

27493: Gloria Swanson plays a spoiled maiden who always gets her way until shipwrecked with her butler, then learns which qualities are really admirable in a person.

24698: When scientists in the year 1964 are confused by evidence of a long-ago space flight, nonagenarian Arnold Bedford (Edward Judd) explains all.

21978: When attending their son’s college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship…but the complicated fact is they’re divorced and he’s remarried.

119726: A celebrated military contractor returns to the site of his greatest career triumphs and re-connects with a long-ago love while unexpectedly falling for the hard-charging Air Force watchdog assigned to him.

118864: Two mismatched personal trainers’ lives are upended by the actions of a new, wealthy client.

43360: A drunken playboy (Russell Brand) stands to lose a wealthy inheritance when he falls for a woman his family doesn’t like.

21460: Yugoslavian beauty Ita Rina stars as Andrea, a trusting country girl who blossoms (and then some) under the touch of worldly visitor Olaf Fjord. After he abandons her, Rina endures single motherhood and marriage to another man, all the while nursing an overwhelming passion for her first lover.

23431: 10-year-old Fiona is sent to live with her grandparents in a small fishing village in Donegal, Ireland. She soon learns the local legend that an ancestor of hers married a Selkie – a seal who can turn into a human.

41331: The Beckmanns used to have more money than they could spend. Now the mother supports her daughter with a small pension in an apartment in Portugal. The daughter, in her mid-50s, never needed a job until now. Filmmaker Eva Mulvad observes their attempts to survive, their hopes and confrontations.

38119: A slobbering St Bernard dog becomes the center of attention for a loving family but its vet secretly wants to kill him.

24450: The story of a petty thief who meets an innocent young woman and brings her into his world of crime while she teaches him the lessons of enjoying life and being loved.

39343: A woman hardened by her past now runs a ranch she acquired through manipulation and bribery

42296: Towering heights and beautiful vistas turn into a nightmare reminiscent of Deliverance in this suspenseful horror film starring Fanny Vallette and Johan Libéreau. A group of friends on vacation in Eastern Europe embarks on an ambitious mountain expedition along a Via Ferrata closed for repair.

26401: Set in 17th-century Mexico during the Inquisition, this tragedy chronicles the true story of a rebellious, highly educated nun—writer/poet Sister Juana Ines de la Cruz (1651-1695)—who is persecuted for her radical ideas, after her mentors, the Spanish Viceroy and his wife, return to Europe.

44301: Mussorgsky’s composition is the soundtrack for this pin-screen animated take on night and wild things.

103054: Marek has no real friends except his guard dog and hangs out with skinheads. When his dispirited mother reappears in his life, Marek faces a horrible predicament. An authentic and hypnotic chronicle of a sluggish existence always on the verge of explosion…

39227: Andy and Elizabeth are sick of life in the city, and decide to move to the country. Buying a home near a picturesque town, they soon discover (to their horror) that things are done differently in the country.

24534: An aspiring actress in New York City becomes upset with the treatment of women in the industry. Out of work and desperate for money, she decides to take a job as a phone-sex operator.

9870: Ludovic is a young boy who can’t wait to grow up to be a woman.

24948: Two Jedi knights, apprentice Obi-Wan Kenobi and his master Qui-Gon Jinn attempt to resolve a dispute between the Trade Federation and planet Naboo. As the conflict escalates they discover ‘The Chosen One’, a young slave destined to bring balance to The Force.
Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace

26565: A father and son ride the rails in their powerful locomotive. Witnessing a crash between two other engines, they rescue the lone survivor, Berenice, and make her a part of their family. All is well until the father and son become rivals for the girl’s affections.
Odilon Redon or The Eye Like a Strange Balloon Mounts Toward Infinity

98496: The bad-guy in an 8-bit arcade game who longs to be a hero brings trouble to his entire arcade when looking for his place in the other video games and unleashing a deadly enemy.

90740: Honeybees have been mysteriously disappearing across the planet, literally vanishing from their hives.  Known as Colony Collapse Disorder, this phenomenon has brought beekeepers to crisis in an industry responsible for producing more than a hundred species of fruits and vegetables.

29902: In a desperate attempt to prove his innocence, a skilled police negotiator accused of corruption and murder takes hostages in a government office to gain the time he needs to find the truth.

48075: When a presidential candidate dies unexpectedly in the middle of the campaign, Washington, D.C. alderman, Mays Gilliam is unexpectedly picked as his replacement.

92711: Scrat undergoes a misadventure as a large stockpile of acorns fall apart.

35153: In the highlands of Scotland in the 1700s, Rob Roy tries to lead his small town to a better future, by borrowing money from the local nobility to buy cattle to herd to market. When the money is stolen, Rob is forced into a Robin Hood lifestyle to defend his family and honour.

90624: Portrait of an imaginary painter based on the life and the work of A. Wiertz
Thoughts and Visions of a Severed Head

28640: The story of Polish pedagogue Janusz Korczak and his dedication to protecting Jewish orphans during the war.

36358: Organism Academy Award winning film maker Hilary Harris’ epic vision of New York City shot over 15 years [1959-74] during which time Mr. Harris pioneered and con-temporized time-lapse film making techniques to achieve this unique experiential view of the world we inhabit.

31095: Clark Kellogg is a young man starting his first year at film school in New York City. After a small time crook steals all his belongings, Clark meets Carmine “Jimmy the Toucan” Sabatini, an “importer” bearing a startling resemblance to a certain cinematic godfather.

29866: Misfit François kidnaps young Mado and takes her to live with him in the attic of his parents’ home. A strange relationship evolves till the police comes upon them.

95614: A man daydreams about what terror could be lurking in his backyard pool.

31339: What happened to Joaquin Phoenix? How did the seemingly shy, intense actor go from young heartthrob to Oscar nominee to punchline to pop culture mystery? Was it a breakdown? A retreat? A hoax? Fellow actor Casey Affleck gets close enough for an accurate look at what was really happening.

28990: Two exotic dancers embark on a friendship which takes a turn when one of them begins having recurring nightmares of her killing people in which the line between realty and fantasy begins to blur to the most extreme.

1512: The experiences of two young English women in India, two generations apart, in the 1920s and 1980s. Anne, a young historical researcher, inherits letters written by her great aunt Olivia, and becomes obsessed with their revelation of an exotic and sensual past.

30163: After two gang-related killings in “Center City,” a suspect (who was framed) is arrested, released on bail…and murdered. Inspector Briggs of the FBI recruits a young agent, Gene Cordell, to go undercover in the shadowy Skid Row area (alias George Manly) as a potential victim of the same racket.

94832: What goes on inside the head of a man who knows he has only 24 hours to live? Franco-Senegalese director Alain Gomis takes viewers through this final day﻿.

108341: Werner Herzog returns to death row to make four more portraits of people on the edge of existence.

2719: The pain of growing up, as seen by three Turkish youths: Ömer, the son of the local imam, who wishes the death of his father; his best friend, Yakup, who’s enamored with the village schoolteacher; and Yildiz, who is forced to balance her studies with the needs of her demanding mother.

374: The style and themes which made Federico Fellini world famous are already apparent in this charming comedy (his first solo directorial effort), featuring such long-time collaborators as his wife, actress Giulietta Masina, and composer Nino Rota.

1476: Ireland 1920: workers from field and country unite to form volunteer guerrilla armies to face the ruthless ‘Black and Tan’ squads that are being shipped from Britain to block Ireland’s bid for independence.
The Wind that Shakes the Barley

15188: A post-apocalyptic about a boy who communicates telepathically with his dog as they scavenge for food and sex.

210: In the depressed post-WWII economy of Italy, a desperate but hopeful family man is on his first day of a new job, when his bicycle is stolen. With his wide-eyed son in tow, he sets off to track down the thief. A landmark in the Italian neorealist movement.

28488: A wonderful short film that examines a series of watercolors of the city of Porto painted by Portugese artist António Cruz.

3427: A jewel thief’s nephew is sent along on a heist to ensure a longtime partner in crime stays honest about the division of the loot.

25641: A seemingly normal family turns out to be a hotbed of neuroses in this disquieting drama from Japanese filmmaker Toshiaki Toyoda.

8779: A kind of sequel to the Rocky Horror Picture Show in which Janet and Brad become contestants on a game show… but wind up as captives instead.

9523: Longfellow Deeds, a simple-hearted Vermont tuba player, inherits a fortune and has to contend with opportunist city slickers.

43087: A parody of Italian photonovels and pop subculture, follows Marino and Marisa, two villagers who love each other very much, until the day Marisa is forced to leave for Rome.
Torture Me But Kill Me with Kisses

38036: Catherine the Great falls in love with an army officer who is plotting against her.

45074: Czech road movie in which three girlfriends want to go to the West after secondary school but have much too much to do in their own country. About discovering life, friendship, love and sex.

27774: The central character is an early version of Elmer Fudd known as Egghead, and most of the cartoon consists of travelogue-type narration and blackout gags, many including Egghead.

83259: The controlled chaos of Robin Williams explodes as the Oscar-winning comic hits the stage for his first stand-up tour in six years. Filmed in Washington, D.C., this Emmy-nominated 2009 HBO special captures all of the funnyman’s high-energy humor.

22894: In 1932, Alice Liddell Hargreaves, age 80, travels to New York to attend a celebration of Lewis Carroll’s centenary. Mrs. Hargreaves begins to remember details of the childhood events that led to the writing of the stories. Was shy Carroll actually in love with her?

99687: Basri, 55 year old, every day walks for miles along the tracks working as a railroad watchman. His nagging thought is finding his son. 18 years ago, while the boy was at the university in Istanbul, the police took him into custody for anti-government activities. Then, he mysteriously disappeared.

24903: MERCY, the last in the series, is encyclopedic ephemera, exploring public visions of technological and romantic invention, dissecting the game mass media plays with our private perceptions.

26682: Two pretty American girls are on a road trip through Europe. In Germany they end up alone at night with a broken car in the woods. They search for help and find an isolated villa.

23962: Johann Rettenberger is a successful marathon runner and a serial bank robber. His addiction to the passion, the kick, the exercise and the symmetry of the perfect robbery propels him to take off for a regular fix—as often as three times a day.

25489: An eloquent and honest look at an everyday family dealing with life’s little curveballs.

12259: A documentary about Klaus Barbie, the Gestapo chief of Lyon, and his life after the war.
Hôtel Terminus: The Life and Times of Klaus Barbie

89341: Music video for the Lady Gaga single “Yoü and I” that includes visual imagery of mermaids and a piano in a cornfield.

134407: Upon losing his wife and son, Ahmet has to struggle with the feeling of loneliness.

3923: Vera Chytilova wrote and directed this two-part story that took the Grand Prix at the Mannheim Film Festival.

1972: A man is supine on a mountain side. Images rush past of nature and a stained glass saint. An infant is born. We see a lactating nipple. Images include a mountain peak, farm buildings, a tree stump, a fire, a crawling baby, and the sun. The man falls and rolls. Then, later, he swings his ax.

368: A lonely American woman unexpectedly finds romance in Venice, Italy.

2705: A serial killer is murdering London women with a necktie. The police have a suspect…but he’s the wrong man.

24563: Second installment of the “Yusuf trilogy” by Turkish auteur Semih Kaplanoglu.

26579: A drama about the fate of brothers forced to fight in the Korean War.
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

27647: Five different criminals face imminent death after botching a job quite badly.
Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead

120970: A story that revolves around three sisters who live in their grandmother’s home and the arrival of their 13-year-old half sister.

After a mysterious stranger accuses him of being responsible for her condition, he re-evaluates his life choices and tries to become a better husband, father and son.

3280: British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gunsight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.

35824: In Connection, a static shot of the sky with moving clouds is subdivided into regular geometrical regions, which are then individually (and rhythmically) manipulated.

34602: Le jardin des délices de Jérôme Bosch

4029: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape, when their ocean liner completely capsizes at sea.

32795: Although barely 30, Claire believes she is showing the first symptoms of Alzheimer’s disease, a condition from which her mother has recently died. Her sister, Nathalie, is certain that her memory loss, caused by a lightning strike, is temporary.

23296: The girl from the title, just starting a new job in a four-star hotel in Paris, is followed for 90 minutes in a moving Bresson-esque film.

47565: Jack Carter, a policeman, goes undercover in an attempt to catch a drug-running gang. The operation goes wrong and Jack is exposed.

24393: Nineteen years after President Timothy Kegan was assassinated, his brother Nick discovers a dying man claiming to have been the gunman. While trying to avoid his wealthy and domineering father’s attempts to control his actions, Nick follows the clues that have been handed to him.

98231: A malfunction threatens to destroy Stitch and his friendship with Lilo!
Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

22360: Maria Wyeth (Tuesday Weld), an ex-model and B-movie actress, strolls on the grounds of a mental hospital, recalling the traumatic events which led to her breakdown.

103797: This is another story of the secret Coast to Coast auto race across America The only rule is, the first to finish is the winner. Naturally, anyone driving 55 isn’t going to win. They’ll need to drive a little faster than that. Well actually, they will need to drive a LOT faster that 55.

87417: Backpacking in the Caucasus Mountains, walking for hours, an engaged couple and their tour guide trade anecdotes and play games to pass the time, until a momentary misstep, that takes only two or three seconds, changes everything.

20331: The farmers lead a wealthy and leisurely existence.  At the borders of their lands, the uneasiness of the indios, who were the legitimate inhabitants of those lands, is rapidly growing.
